Reviews.Title: “castex hotel paris”
Reviews.Author: JeffR364
Reviews.Content: excellent small hotel in marais, bastille area ideal for exploring central paris and beyond fairly quiet location, very close to metro stop lots of good restuarants, cafes nearby staff very friendly and helpful. nice relaxed feel. rooms old style feel with tiled floors and simple furnishing. HD TV linked to BBC world service channel good bath & hot powerful shower en suite will be back

Reviews.Title: “Holiday destination overview”
Reviews.Author: Lesley C
Reviews.Content: When planning for our 9 day stay in Paris, quality and well located accommodation rated highly in the selection process. We were not to be disappointed. Hotel Castex presents the charm of Paris and is ideally located to all points of interest for the tourist. After a day of sight seeing, it was a pleasure to return to the comfort of our room to recover prior to bedding down for a peaceful nights sleep. The room was thoroughly cleaned each day. Hotel staff were obliging and helpfull at all times. Should we return to Paris we would definitely stay at Hotel Castex.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Whelkie
Reviews.Content: Great central location for exploring Paris. Close to Bastille metro. Good restaurants nearby. Reception staff very helpful. Rooms are small-ish, but very clean. Bathroom looked new. My only criticism is the thinness of the walls. You can hear the conversations in the next room. On both mornings I was woken by the next room's alarm clock. But the location, cleanliness and friendliness makes this a thoroughly recommendable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent value for money - would definitely recommend!! Location was great with the metro a two minute walk away, there were plenty of cafe bars & restaurants within a few minutes walking distance. Staff very friendly & helpful. Our room was at the rear of the hotel through the garden & we didn't hear a sound at all during our stay. We would definitely stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A true 3 star in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ana_diav
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Castex was perfectly situated for the semi-marathon. It is a short walk from Bastille Metro and the 1 line which is very convenient when traveling around Paris. Eskender at the front desk was cheerful and helpful. The room was nice with a shower.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel with Good Location”
Reviews.Author: sd2734
Reviews.Content: Hotel is conveniently located close to Place de la Bastille and within a short walk one could easily get to the Paris Metro. I think that within this price range the hotel is a definite bargain given the strategic location. The area is nice with a lot of nearby shops and some restaurants. Bofinger is a great restaurant and is a short 5min hike from the hotel. Bofinger specializes in Alsatian cuisine and is operated by the owners of the famous La Coupole. About the Hotel. It is a small hotel so do not expect swimming pools or spas. The appearance is clean, but somewhat cramped. The rooms. They are clean but tiny! However, in Europe hotel space tends to be much smaller than in the US. Be that as it may, do not bring over huge pieces of luggage because you may end up without enough space to store your suitcases. The hotel also offers English style breakfast for only 10 euros per person, which is a good value to start your long day of sightseeing in Paris. The Front Desk people are friendly and knowledgeable so make sure to utilize them.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a few days in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Lynne53
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate enough to have 2 days in Paris and always feel at home in the Marais. Hotel Castex fit the bill completely ( thank you Tripadvisor and bookings.com). Quiet , clean, friendly, nice breakfast in the cellar ( skip the scrambled eggs) and fantastic position. One negative - the first room we were offered had been smoked in and stunk like an ashtray. Someone was breaking Parisian law. The gentleman at reception was very apologetic and more than happy to move us. Perhaps housekeeping needs to report this sort of thing to management. In summary, we would happily stay at Hotel Castex again for a short stay. Most Paris hotel rooms are small and we prefer short stay apartments for anything longer. castex

Reviews.Title: “December in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Monica G
Reviews.Content: Comfortable hotel. Quiet, nice bath room, good breakfasts. Great location near metro stop. Helpful, friendly staff. Check in and check out were easy. They helped me get an inexpensive shuttle to the airport. I'd go back to the Castex Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Awesomejoha
Reviews.Content: I recommend Hotel Castex for a short or long visit to Paris. It's located near Metro Bastille, surrounded by many restaurants and stores. Rooms are not small at all, with very comfortable beds. Hot water in the shower. And personal service is excellent. Above all: everything was so clean. The price per night is very good. It has a restaurant for having french breakfast: croissant, french bread, jelly, nutella, orange and apple juice. Coffee, fruits, and a very accurate price. Totally recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Not an authentic French experience....”
Reviews.Author: naturelover60
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights in September. Our room was on two levels, which we personally do not care for. The floor seemed dirty, and I did notify the staff on leaving; they were very responsive to my input. There are many better locations in Paris than that of the Hotel Castex. The traffic in this area is awful, so noise can be a problem. If you want an authentic French experience, it's not to be had in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Handy for Bastille Opera and the Marais”
Reviews.Author: Freischutz
Reviews.Content: Situaled in a quiet street a short walk from Bastille Metro, this hotel is easy for those reliant on public transport. And who would choose to drive in Paris anyway? The rooms are smallish (but aren't they all in Parisian hotels), but well furnished and equipped. A good place for two or three nights. Friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “simple and good”
Reviews.Author: lyrictravel
Reviews.Content: small room (standart in this district, as the housing possibilities are very narrow). simple furniture, not very new but well maintained hotel. pleasent quiet, nevertheless very centrally located. attentive staff. room to courtyard light and air spoiled as there are not high buildings around. good mattress. good value on this expensive city! only disadvantage: the breakfast is a disaster! 10 Euros can be spend much better, as for "plastic" cheese (in france!!!) and artificial (powder) scrambled eggs. apart from that very good.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, comfortable, great bathroom for a 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peter V
Reviews.Content: Two minutes walk from Bastille the hotel is central enough to be handy for most attractions and far enough away from the centre to be reasonably priced. Hotel Castex is a straightforward, Parisian 3 star hotel, so the room is small but very comfortable, the bathroom was excellent (new, clean, powerful shower, deep bath just what you need after a long day sightseeing) and the staff helpful without getting too involved. We liked it a lot and will go back next time we are in Paris

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, 5 mins walk to the Seine”
Reviews.Author: G0Traveller
Reviews.Content: Very friendly hotel, very close to the Metro and within walking distance to the Latin quarter where we ate every evening - lots of choice of restaurants of numerous nationalities. The room was fine and had a new bathroom with good shower AND bath (much needed after a day traipsing round the sights). Several cafes nearby for breakfast. Good value for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Brief personal stay in Paris, a break in a lengthy stay in Europe for my work.”
Reviews.Author: Dianne G
Reviews.Content: A delightful hotel, with a PERFECT location. The BEST little place I've ever stayed in in the Marais District! A MOST enjoyable stay. Staff was very personable. The Reception area was friendly and well appointed (magazines, brochures/information), and warm to sit and prepare to visit the city! It's on the list for next time.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, quiet and near all the sites”
Reviews.Author: Graham R
Reviews.Content: A hotel down a quiet side street so not much noise, yet near the main sites and good access to the Metro. Plenty of local restaurants. Hotel was clean and staff friendly and helpful. Just what we were looking for as a base to see Paris. I'd certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location & Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: TheCards
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Castex for a total of 7 nights. 4 with a Rick Steves tour and 3 nights on our own. Were in rooms 201 & 301 and both were setup the same. Clean, good bathroom and plenty of room by Paris standards. Both rooms faced the streetside of the hotel but it was not noisy. Plenty of restaurants nearby, ATMs are close, as well as a grocery store and laundrette. Staff very helpful and pleasant. Complementary bottle of wine was nice after a day of exploring Paris.

Reviews.Title: “An ideal base from which to explore!”
Reviews.Author: Hifidelity
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location, we had a street facing room and expected it to be noisy, however the Rue de Castex is a side road and consquently relatively quite for a city street. We did not have breakfast as the local cafe's offered a fantastic choice of fresh pasteries & coffee. The room was not small by Paris standards & offered everything you needed .... comfortable bed, plenty of storage space, hairdryer, and it was lovely to be able to open the french windows to peer down at the street below. The reception staff were friendly and efficient and able to answer any questions we had. All in all we felt it was good value and we will use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “cleanliness, friendliness of staff and location make this my first choice in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Jennynew
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a three night stay in Paris, doing a recce for the student group of 30 I will be taking in April (but not staying at Castex). I have stayed here many times with friends/partner before it had its revamp (and prices went up accordingly) and also once or twice more recently. We did have a break from it and stayed elsewhere in the Marais / Quartier Latin but I have to say that I would now choose the Castex every time. The room had a high ceiling, so in spite of it being a single, had a comfortable small double bed and was quiet. There was enough room to unpack properly and to have books, maps etc on surfaces. The staff were so pleasant and courteous and the breakfast, although 10 euros, was in a calm atmosphere and offered fresh fruit salad, decent coffee and good quality bread and croissants -the reviewers who moan about the cold scrambled eggs should stick to the way the continentals take their petit dejeuner. I was able to keep my things in my room until midday, which was when I planned to leave anyway. The hotel is so near all the best areas in Paris for walking and restaurants, and the metro is very close. The no. 4 Air France bus from CDG goes to Gare de Lyon, which is a bus or metro ride away (but also walkable). Gare du Nord and Eurostar is also straightforward.

Reviews.Title: “Castex Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Tomolko T
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Castex for 9 days in Paris. We definitely recommend this place to our friends. The hotel room was small (which we expected in Paris), but it was very clean and pleasant. The hotel is located in a great neighborhood of Le Marais where you can find everything you need. Many landmarks and metro stations are short walking distance and the hotel is located on a quieter street that meets major streets. Using well connected Metro lines, going to different parts of Paris was very easy. The hotel staffs are very helpful and kind, and speak English well. We will stay here again when we visit Paris next time. Only thing we missed was a small refrigerator. It would have been convenient for us to store food items we brought from nearby stores.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly welcome, comfortable room, great area”
Reviews.Author: noojeenut
Reviews.Content: We travelled by Eurostar from London, and finding this hotel couldn't have been easier. Jumped on the metro at Gare du Nord and in minutes we were walking out of Bastille Metro station and walking a couple of hundred metres to the hotel. We arrived too early to check in, but were greeted with a friendly welcome and invited to leave our bags with the hotel and go out and explore Paris. On our return at around 4.00pm, were were advised that the triple room we had booked for ourselves and 6 year old daughter, was unavailable, and were were given two adjoining rooms with a common hall/vestibule area for the same price. The rooms were on the second floor and easily accessed via a lift. Both rooms were spacious and comfortable. Both had small balconettes, one looking over the street, the other over a small courtyard at the rear. There were tea and coffee making facilities and a lovely touch of a complimentary bottle of wine. Rooms were clean and well appointed (beds could do with updating but were not uncomfortable), good bathrooms with shower over bath in one room and shower only in the other. The water pressure was good and temperature constant. There were wardrobes/ cupboards/desks etc. Plenty of space, particularly on Paris standards. Situated right next to Bastille (where there is an excellent market in the mornings), the Seine is a couple of minutes walk, as are the shops and restaurants of Rue Rivoli and all the colour of the Marais district. Breakfast is offered in a charming 'cave' like room downstairs, however we opted to buy a variety of delacacies from the local market as we only had a couple of days to explore Paris. I would certainly stay at the Castex again!

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: aviationduo
Reviews.Content: Castex is a clean hotel, well located, with an accommodating and friendly staff. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected!”
Reviews.Author: LucyLyn
Reviews.Content: The most positive comment I can make about this hotel is that it's near the Bastille Metro stop, in a nice location by the Place des Vosges. We stayed at the Hotel Castex while we were on a Rick Steves tour. First, I'd like to point out that the tour group is extremely efficient. When the group returns to spend its last night in Paris at the hotel, room numbers are assigned in advance. All we had to do is give the staff person our room number to get our key. No one clogged up the small reception area. As to how individual Americans who own Rick Steves books behave, I can't say, but I would like to add that my husband and I felt we were treated wonderfully wherever we went in France, even when we weren't with the tour. The manager at the Hotel Castex was very polite and tried to be helpful, but he wasn't. We arrived a day earlier than the tour group, and at the time we booked our room, we were assured we wouldn't have to move. It was a different story when we arrived. It couldn't be done. And we were told that although our room included a free breakfast with the tour group, we would have to pay for it the first night we booked on our own. The manager felt badly that he had to move us and promised a better room with a garden view, but that didn't happen, either. When when we returned for our last night, at the end of our tour, we were given another room on the noisy street, with twin beds this time, (although we requested a double.) Finally, when we checked out, we were told that breakfast was included for our first night...but we'd gone somewhere else. Regarding the room itself, the decor was depressing, the bed was uncomfortable and the rough floor mat by the bed was disgusting on bare feet. All three of rooms we stayed in had moldy grout in the bathrooms...but the AC worked well. We stayed at Rick Steves recommended hotels all over Italy in May and would return to every single one…but not the Hotel Castex.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: rwbinnyc
Reviews.Content: we took a chance on Castex and found it to be a nice place to stay within walking distance of LeMarais area, lots of restaurants and sites. The staff was very helpful and friendly. We had a triple room which was up a small outdoor stairwell to the second floor. I could see how people with mobility issues might have difficulty getting up to the room. The hotel is around the corner from Bastille metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: SaraGarza719
Reviews.Content: I loved staying here; it's located in the Marais and if you are visiting Paris for the first time you MUST spend a few days immersing yourself in this Arrondissement. It is chock full of boutiques, cafes, and locals. I find this is the best people watching and unique affordable shopping. The hotel itself is a typical European hotel; not a lot of glitz and glamour but an American style bathroom, internet for free in lobby and a great french breakfast served in the basement every morning. It's close to the metro and within walking distance from Notre Dame and the Bastille.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, rooms relatively small but reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: bauwens
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Castex a number of times over the last eight to ten years. I had to check and to my surprise apparently I never wrote a review. I have seen its rating drop from around 100 to a bit above 300. The Castex remains my preferred hotel in Paris within its price range. Whenever I could not go there because booking at the last minute, i have stayed at a number of other hotesl, some of which I did review. I still prefer the Castex. One issue is location; I like the Marais. Proximity to the Bastille subway is good. This time, i just spent a night in Paris before flying home the next day. Somehow, after a glass of armagnac too many the previous evening, I woke up around 9 am and my flight was at 11:10... A bit scary but i did make it. Quick shower, I skipped breakfast, no luggage to check, and I guess I got lucky with the subway and the RER. both trains appeared almost as i walked into the station. (Not that I recommend anyone to live that way; it does get stressfull.) But also, if comparing with Quartier Latin, first its price is much more reasonable than similar hotels there. But more importantly, there is a number of reasonable restaurants around there, while in the Quartier Latin, so far I have not been able to find one that was not a tourist trap. Some reviews have mentioned the Rick Steeves connexion as a big minus, and I can see why. Interestingly, waiting for a friend and sitting in the lobby, the guy at the reception started chatting, and he brought up the issue of the Rick Steeves groups. I'll skip most of his comments, but the important detail that he mentioned was that apparently the hotel does not plan to renew the Steeves contract. Which is expensive to them, when they normally have no difficulty filling the hotel up. That their presence detracts to the hotel's image was not mentioned, but I suppose it's kind of obvious.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Wendyrun
Reviews.Content: So we're directionally challenged and the metro stop that we needed to get to this hotel was closed. The hotel had this information plastered all over their web site, but I didn't absorb it - only later recalled that they had indeed advised how to get there due to closure. Oh well! A little extra walking. Hotel close to metro stops otherwise! Rooms small and clean, a free bottle of wine (meh), and exceptionally friendly and helpful front desk. They gave us a great recommendation for where to go for dinner as well as directions to TGV station (we screwed that up too but didn't miss the train). Breakfast was well stocked - a nice choice of fresh yogurt and breads, as well as some hot dishes that we heard being microwaved (and elected not to eat). Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Rick Steves was spot on”
Reviews.Author: PennyE
Reviews.Content: Perfect location in a very hectic city. Out of the Bastile Metro, a few blocks and voila ~your hotel down a quiet side street. The breakfast sustained us until afternoon cocktails and snacks. The A/C worked wonderfully and the concierge was most helpful. We were able to stroll to the Seine each night for a perfect day's ending.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Toulousian
Reviews.Content: The rooms may be small but, hey, we are in Paris on a budget. I was in Room 605 on the ground floor off the courtyard. This room has a comfortable queen size bed. The room, as I said, was small but it and the modern style bathroom was neat, clean and comfortable. What more can one want?

Reviews.Title: “Very good base for a visit to Paris”
Reviews.Author: ELear
Reviews.Content: As a base for a visit to Paris, the Castex was a very good choice. The room was maybe a bit small, but it was comfortable and quiet, and I slept well, which was all I wanted. Location is excellent, only a few minutes walk in one direction from the Place des Vosges (beautiful), with Victor Hugo's house, a few minutes in another for the Marais, and a few in another from the Place de la Bastille, from where you can get the metro or, if you don't feel like the metro, a bus - there are buses from there to the centre (Ile de la Cite, Louvre, the Seine, Sainte Chapelle, etc) or in the opposite direction to Pere Lachaise. There are also buses to the Gare Montparnasse, which can be handy if you're getting a train. It's in a good area for eating too - some expensive brasseries in the Marais, with various more ordinary bistrots and the like (on the Rue Rivoli, for example), and ethnic take-away stalls (e.g. Mexican) round the Place de la Bastille itself at night. Helpful people on the front desk. Useful room on the ground floor where you could leave luggage, shopping, etc. Not too expensive, at least for Paris

Reviews.Title: “A very "Parisian" hotel”
Reviews.Author: a_ntv_milano
Reviews.Content: A very "Parisian" hotel. Little rooms, but full of charme, perfect little details, as free wifi, 24/h open, location in the center and near the metro. I've appreciated the free Internet computer located in the hall very useful to check the tourist sites without the need to take my laptop with me for a three days stay.

Reviews.Title: “One Individual Can Spoil a good Story”
Reviews.Author: GWJ312
Reviews.Content: My family have stayed at the Castex before and we know and love the area well. We arrived this time on a Saturday and the man at reception was genial and helpful On Monday he was replaced by a surly, pony tailed man who seem to be the week day regular reception. We were treated coldly and without grace. Come time to leave on a rainy Paris day and our request for a taxi was obliged but within 5 minutes he announced n "no taxi possible". In the street I found my own taxi and we we on our way.

Reviews.Title: “not nice. photos do not show true picture”
Reviews.Author: travelercalif86
Reviews.Content: The place is a dump. Nothing nice about it. And the rooms are TINY, bleak and just plain sad.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: NimsM
Reviews.Content: I stayed for an extra couple of days in Paris after a business trip. I didn't care much for the hotel I stayed at for work, so I looked online for another place for the personal part of the trip. Castex sounded nice, and I'm so glad I picked this place. I liked pretty much eveything about it: the building, the decor, the cleanliness and the location. The staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast is served in a room that used to be the cellar - very quaint! The lady who was overseeing breakfast looked a bit grumpy the one time I was there but that was probably my fault for turning up minutes before service stopped. Can't really blame her for giving me dirty looks! I would definitely return here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MelloTravelers
Reviews.Content: Tripadvisor should remove the preceding prejudiced comments!! That being said, the hotel room was wonderful, clean (yes, even the floor), and in a great location. A short walk to the Metro and bus stop and a short ride to the Eiffel Towel and museums. The staff was very helpful!

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is a Rick Steves victim.”
Reviews.Author: YewFatt
Reviews.Content: To be fair, the owners provided us with excellent and efficient service. They kindly arranged another room for us facing the courtyard because our room facing the street was too noisy at night. They also helped us booked a cab and advised us on the fare we should pay. Location was ok, close to Bastille Metro stop. I think the Marais area is kind of over-rated. Many shops not open until late in the afternoon and some of them stayed closed for some reason. It's very near to victor hugo's mansion though. I enjoyed myself more at the montmarte area. The room was as usual in Paris, Tiny. But the tiled flooring for both rooms i stayed in, was sticky and dirty. I think it's an American thing. They don't take off the shoes in the room and sleep with their shoes on ? The cleaning lady must have gave up on mopping the floor. I saw her cleaning the room, she only vaccumed the room. Didn't mop the floor. There is a small kettle in the room though. The design of the hotel, I find it weird. The lobby has lots of character and nice furniture in contrast to the boring design of the rooms. The elevator is a modern elevator. I would say it's a new addition to the hotel. There are 3 large garbage bins in the courtyard that spoil the view. It seems that is their permanent resting place. Tip : stay on the 1st floor, you can still get some wifi access. Anything higher, you get no wifi at all. For some reason, my credit card couldn't get through for this hotel. Even though I used it during the same period for 2 other hotels in Paris with no problem. Bring extra euros in cash in case the same happens to you. I won't recommend this hotel unless you are American.

Reviews.Title: “Authentic downtown Paris hotel with American-style amenities, near all the action”
Reviews.Author: aertraveler
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I have stayed in the Marais neighborhood of Paris, and the second great hotel I found there. Hotel Castex is an authentic Paris hotel with a small storefront lobby, narrow elevator, and large windows that open out over a narrow side street. Yet it had queen beds (not fulls!), lovely bathrooms with shower/tubs and hairdryers and complimentary products, flat screen tvs, internet access in the lobby, and lots of closet space to spread out your stuff. For the price and location, these were hard to get amenities. The Marais is a great neighborhood with lots of great, affordable dining and easy access to the Metro yellow line which goes to many major attractions without transfers. The cleaning staff was really great to us, and the front desk staff were the standard Parisian-aloof but still courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but could be better”
Reviews.Author: Mojopin66
Reviews.Content: I guess the saving grace of this place is the location. Breakfast was ok, nothing to write home about - there's enough to get you going for the day. However, there was no signage to indicate that breakfast was an additional cost and the concierge never mentioned it. It was only when we paid up at the end that we were told it was extra for each of us (around €10 if I remember correctly?). I suppose I should have checked, but it was still annoying to not have been told up front as we checked in. The room we were in was very, very small, but it definitely had its charm. There were these side "nooks" in the walls next to our beds that were coated in dust. It would have been nice to have had that bit of detail sorted out. Our sleep was a bit disturbed as the doors seemed to slam all through the night as people came and went. It wasn't the patrons' fault - for some reason the doors would swing back very quickly, so we had to put up with this all night. I felt that it was a tad pricey given what we got - we have paid less for better, but I guess the compromise was in the location. If you're after convenient location and are not particulary fussy about your rooms, then this is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location for Paris”
Reviews.Author: dksfmn
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Castex probably 5-6 times since 1995. It has changed slightly from the secret family run 2 star hotel that should be a 3 star to the deserving 3 star rating it has now. I find it to be a very comfortable stay every time. The rooms are well kept and clean. Some stays I have heard some noise from the street early morning but for the most part the sleep is quiet and easy. The staff is always excellent and helpful. Multi-lingual. They have provided help with air travel, luggage issues, and other services. The past few years I have noticed that "Rick Steves" tour groups stay here. they can be a bit of a burden if you are trying to check in/out or get some service when they mob the front desk. One incredible about this hotel is location. In a corner of the Marais right near the Bastille. The metro stop with many lines is nearby, as well as you can walk to the city center easily if you wish.

Reviews.Title: “Service was terrible, American guests were horrible, showers were unusable”
Reviews.Author: MrZero
Reviews.Content: Three things stand out in my memory. First, almost every guest was an American with Rick Steves' guidebook. They were fairly rude to the staff, begging for the discount, and completely oblivious to everything but themselves. It was almost as bad as if they were all on a guided tour in matching t-shirts. Also, due to the overwhelming number of Americans, the hotel served a lackluster American-style continental breakfast instead of the wonderful European breakfast I expected, and we had to pay extra to boot. Second, the shower was ridiculous. We requested a shower bathroom because we were traveling through after an extended trip in a developing nation and we looked forward to long, hot showers. We knew it would be small by American standards, and it was about normal for a European shower. However, it was completely impractical. There was NO shelf inside the shower for soap or toiletries, or anywhere to hang a washcloth. There was nowhere to hang a towel nearby. And, the curtain blew open constantly and the water ran everywhere on the floor of the bathroom. I believe I read that the French prefer bathtubs, and apparently Hotel Castex has no idea how a shower should even work. Finally, the service was a horrendous. I believe this was a result of the above-mentioned rude treatment from many of the guests, and the Parisians' rude treatment of tourists in general (I say this without any prejudice whatsoever - the six days we spent in Paris we, we were treated worse than any other country we have ever been in the world). Even though we gave advance notice that we were traveling through Paris after our extended trip in a developing country and requested an early check-in, when we arrived, our room was not ready and we were forced to wander aimlessly for an hour (after twelve hours on a plane and several days without a proper shower). I believe the staff only let us into our room early to be rid of us. When we checked out, the staff very nearly made us miss our return flight. We came outside to discover that a political rally had shut down traffic for several blocks around the hotel and the nearby Bastille. We hiked into the nearest Metro station, only to discover it unattended and with the sole ticket machine unable to read any of our credit cards (which work fine). When we hiked back up to the hotel to explain our situation, the staff refused to give us any coins in exchange for bills (the metro machines only take coins). After being similarly denied by three servers and a bartender at a nearby cafe, we returned to the hotel and requested that they call us a taxi cab. The staffer informed us that it would be a while due to the traffic shut down because of the protest, which we readily accepted, as the train rides themselves would take almost as much time as we had remaining before our flight at this point. After five minutes waiting outside, I stepped in to see where we would meet our taxi, only to discover that the staffer had not even called for one yet. He then proceeded to inform me that another Metro station about five minutes in the other direction was staffed every day, and would take our credit cards or bills. This info could have been passed on half an hour earlier and saved us lots of time and anxiety. We literally made the airport gate as the plane was loading and, had the American Airlines staff not helped us through security, we would have missed the flight. I will never stay here again. I highly recommend that you find somewhere else as well. We also stayed in the Hotel Lenox St. Germain in a different neighborhood and it was great, I suggest you look it up if that location suits you!

Reviews.Title: “Second stay at this hotel and it only...”
Reviews.Author: Puppy_Asta
Reviews.Content: Second stay at this hotel and it only gets better. For a three star hotel in a very convenient location, I would thoroughly recommend it. The staff are very helpful, room very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A True Steal - 5 Star Value!”
Reviews.Author: sconnienation10
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for 2 nights, and were so pleasantly surprised. The room was a bit on the pricey side for us (150 euro/night), but the amenities more than made up for it. We requested a double, but they gave us a triple with no added charge. Rooms are huge and pristine, free wi-fi, awesome shower, and convenient location near Notre-Dame. Staff is friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay at this hidden gem again!

Reviews.Title: “A very tasteful hotel”
Reviews.Author: kingfish321
Reviews.Content: Loved the stay, very tasteful, good location, staff is great, Eskander is the best, they made me feel home, I moved out for a different hotel because that was 10 euro cheaper, fled back the second day. Will return for sure;

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Urb456
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with our 3 teenagers, and had a double room and a triple room. The rooms are small, but the beds were very comfortable, the AC worked wel, the front desk staff was helpful and the maid service good. The location is great - about 2 blocks from the Bastille metro stop, which serves 3 lines.

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: dokel
Reviews.Content: We had a double room that was so tiny; however, by standards in France for 3 star hotels, it was probably an average size. When we stayed, the air conditioning was broken which made it hard to sleep;however, the front desk person loaned us a fan which helped a lot. The front staff was very helpful and friendly and would answer any questions you had. It is an expensive hotel for what you are getting, but the location in the Marais district is great as it blocks from the Bastille metro and walking distance to many sights.

Reviews.Title: “It's OK, but not a three-star place -- let's not get carried away...”
Reviews.Author: out8974
Reviews.Content: Many of the comments I've read seem overly enthusiastic -- "lovely", "charming", etc, it's not. What it is is an OK value -- not a great one -- and a good location. If functional and clean is what you're after -- and you want a hotel in this part of the city, then this will do fine. If what you're after is a romantic, or quaint, or lovely little gem of a hotel, then this isn't the place for you. I'd get a room on the courtyard, if possible. The hotel is only two doors down from Boulevard Henri IV, which is not a quiet street. Unless you get noisy neighbors on your floor, you'll probably get a good night's sleep -- we did. Pros - clean, air conditioned, good location, metro stop 2 blocks away Cons - rooms are cramped (you can't walk across the room without turning sideways to get between the bed and the wall) and need updating (walls cracked, need fresh paint)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Amaklo
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights here. We had two rooms, a single and a twin (two twin beds). Both rooms were comfortable. The staff was helpful and spoke good English. The location near the Bastille metro stop was perfect, close to many tourist sites (Place des Vosges, the Marais, Notre Dame, etc.) but on a quiet street. I've been to Paris several times and this is an excellent value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, perfect location, perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: DallasPatty
Reviews.Content: This was the third time I have stayed at the Castex Hotel and as always, had a wonderful time. Helpful staff, small but clean rooms, on a quiet side street, but more than anything else, location - location - location! Convenient to the metro, historical landmarks, bistros, bakeries, wine/cheese shops, markets - perfect little home base for exploring the beautiful city of Paris. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to friends, family, or anyone visiting Paris for the purpose of enjoying everything the city has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, service and style”
Reviews.Author: Melbournegirl007
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Castex 3 times in the duration of my trip. Each time the room was spotless, service was excellent with great advice and sleep was comfortable after many kms of walking and stairs! Great location near to Bastille making it easy to get about on the Metro or walk to the Marais and key attractions. I loved it and would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: TSKTJK
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Paris for a long weekend and to celebrate our anniversary. The hotel was great in terms of both the location, cleanliness and service. Both Martin and Eskonder (behind the desk) were so helpful and friendly. We would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, but expected more”
Reviews.Author: fromdenile
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Castex for one night before starting an apartment rental. As claimed, it was very clean and the staff friendly, but I can't credit it with being the great value that others described. Both the room and bathroom were tiny. There wasn't even a shelf or anything to put soap or shampoos on in the shower and you couldn't bend over. The breakfast was very expensive for just being juice, coffee, baguette and croissant. We were forced to spend additional days in Paris (to our great pleasure!) due to the volcanic ash and I was easily able to find a hotel in the same area that was equally as clean, with very helpful staff, equal cleanliness and more charm. I found the Castex to be a little blah and sterile. It's a decent enough place, just not worthy of it's current ranking.

Reviews.Title: “very nice and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: helderbiarrtz
Reviews.Content: we had a lovely stay at the Castex Hotel There was sky window and it was so pretty to see the stars at night The staff was very friendly and helpful Very close to the metro Bastille

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Nick J
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Hotel Castex during our visit to Paris. It was very clean, all of the staff were very friendly, and they spoke English readily. I felt that the room rate was appropriate for the size and quality of the room. The bed was very comfortable. The room is small, but so are all the rooms in paris, and we weren't there to hang out in our hotel room anyway! The location is wonderful - on the southern edge of the Marais, 1/2 block from the Bastille Metro, and about 15 minutes to Notre Dame. We would recommend this hotel to anybody who goes to visit Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Castex always good”
Reviews.Author: petrafaber
Reviews.Content: I've been staying in Hotel Castex for five times now and it never disapointed. The rooms are small but good, the staff is friendly and helpfull. And, the last but not the least, the location is perfect! At the end of the street is a parking. When you're from Amsterdam, the parkingrates of this garage are almost for free: 65 euro's for three days. But the subway also stops almost in front of the hotel. With Bofinger, the Marais, Centre Pompidou and Chez Georges in the neighbourhood, you will have a perfect stay at Hotel Ceatex.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall value for the location”
Reviews.Author: DCJoe
Reviews.Content: I'd only been to Europe on business travel, and stayed at nice hotels paid for by employers, so I was leary about finding something reasonably priced AND good given the stories I've heard of microscopic rooms and non-stop street noise. This hotel overall is a great value - located just off the Bastille (3 Metro lines pass there), it's a 10-minute walk to the Marais or Ile St. Louis & Ile de la Cite. The rooms are clean, the beds comfortable, and the front desk staff helpful and friendly. My only two complaints were that the wireless access didn't work in my room except briefly, so I had to keep going to the lobby the whol trip. Also, if you have noisy neighbors, you will hear everything in this hotel. They should invest in some large rugs for each room, to help absorb some of the noise. Outside street noise, however, was minimal and I slept well overall.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless”
Reviews.Author: aswinning_11
Reviews.Content: Location: I went to Paris with a friend to attend a private concert in the 6è arrondissement (near Notre-Dame). We arrived by car at about 4 PM and checked in the Castex hotel. It's hard to find a free parking place in the street itself (no private parking and street not free) so we put our car in a private parking near the hotel. For that we paid about 30 euros for 24 hours but at least it was safe and you don't want anything to happen to your car (especially with a foreign licence plate). Hotel located in a quiet narrow street between two big streets. Next to Place de la Bastille and metro Bastille. Safe area (we walked back at night from Notre-Dame, about 25' walk along the Seine). The hotel: We stayed only one night in a single room (one double bed) for 110€ without any meals. Hotel is pretty inside (very romantic and rustic - check their website). Our room was on the fourth floor (elevator). Pretty back view from the window. Nice price I say seeing the location, the facilities and the hotel (***). Enough space for two, very clean modern bathroom, one small flat-screen Philips TV, adjustable aircon, extra pillows, closets, a safe, small desk. Nothing to complain about. Staff: Nice polite helpful lady when I checked in/out. Another man was there for the night shift. Nothing special to say as we didn't stay long in the hotel and we spoke French so didn't test their language skills. It was my first online booking. I suggest you call the hotel for confirmation after booking online. It takes you only 30 seconds and you're sure if you have your room. We paid at check-out by credit card.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, beautiful French hotel where you feel like home...”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Bambi_2010
Reviews.Content: We have had a very good time in this hotel, located in a very beautiful part of Paris. It's only three minutes away from the underground station and close to lots of Paris' attractions. Personnel of the hotel was always friendly, nice and helpful and next time we visit Paris, we will definitely stay only in this hotel. Merci beaucoup to all the guys from beautiful "Castex Hotel" for making our time in Paris so wonderful and unforgettable!

Reviews.Title: “weekend break”
Reviews.Author: LondonLondon28
Reviews.Content: Travelling to France for the first time and never been to Paris before - i was after a cheap hotel in a safe area. Castex is certainly that and would recommend it to anyone - its not posh - but has a clean bed and comfortable mattress. The only down side was my room smelt of smoke - but 15 minutes with the window open it was gone!

Reviews.Title: “charming small hotel in marais district”
Reviews.Author: DCSpokane
Reviews.Content: helpful staff and nice breakfast room - convenient to restaurants and sights near the Bastille

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: francophileDurham
Reviews.Content: Nothing fancy but more than good enough and ideally situated as our repeated visits testify.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service, comfortable beds, great location”
Reviews.Author: reviewmaven
Reviews.Content: My adult daughter and I stayed at the Hotel Castex last week, and were really pleased. We arrived early in the morning directly from the airport, and the clerk let us check in immediately -- even though official check in time is not until 11 a.m. Staff speaks English. Don't expect anything fancy, but this is perfect for value travelers. Free wifi too. Tips: (1) Do the all you can eat continental breakfast for 10 Euros. Excellent value and pleasant setting with delicious coffee, croissants, crusty French bread, cereal, yogurt, apples, bananas, pears, tangerines, etc. (2) The hotel can arrange for a shuttle to pick you up at the airport. Do it. (My daughter and I took RER and Metro to hotel, which was o.k. except that there were lots of stations without elevators. We did the shuttle on our return to airport, and got picked up right in front of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel - ideal location, friendly staff, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: bernieSurrey_Uk
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Caxtex twice now and hope to go back there on our next trip. The location is perfect, the hotel is quiet, our room was very comfortable and the staff are both helpful and friendly. No complaints whatsoever. Surrey couple.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, nice staff, good location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Hugo_Tribeca
Reviews.Content: First room proposed was very cold (ground floor, view to the garden, heating undersized). Had to change rooms. To be avoided in winter. Second room (1st floor) was warmer, but small, like all the rooms apparently (hard to find a place for the luggage, without disturbing). Apart from that, hotel is charming, very well located, quiet, staff is very nice and very helpful. Didn't try the breakfast. Free internet connection is reasonable (takes some time to get it...). Will nevertheless recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for our needs”
Reviews.Author: waterboyzoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Castex (for the first time) over Christmas 2009. The four of us (parents and teenage children) were given rooms that were the only ones on a shared corridor giving the feeling of almost having connecting rooms. This was a very positive arrangement from our point of view but may be a disadvantage if the people in the next room are inconsiderate. The rooms were clean, pleasantly decorated and a bit larger than you can usually expect in central Paris. The bathroom looked like it had been remodelled within the last few years and everything worked as it should have. We were always greeted in a friendly manner by the staff and the breakfast, which we ate only on one occasion, was a good typical French hotel 'petit déjeuner'. We know the area around the hotel quite well from previous visits and the Castex is perfect for the Marais, Notre Dame, Rue de Rivoli, and via metro, the rest of the centre of Paris. We would return in an instant and I have no hesitation in recommending the Castex to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to sights, transportation and restaurants and a friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shlepalong
Reviews.Content: Located on a quiet street, the small hotel met our expectations. The rooms were clean, however, very small, the staff was friendly, and breakfast was ample. The location was ideal, being near the Marais and the Bastille Metro stop.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel with attentive service, spotless housekeeping and a great location.”
Reviews.Author: eword1949
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our 23-year-old son stayed at the Hotel Castex while visiting our 21-year-old son who was in Paris on study abroad w Sarah Lawrence College. We had separate rooms and bathrooms adjoined by a hallway. It was perfect because our younger son stayed with us for several nights during our stay. Their room had twin beds. Be advised that the wireless Internet access was available to us only in the lobby, so I took my netbook there to use it. Also there is a computer in the lobby. The rooms are narrow, but very pleasant. The croissants at breakfast were wonderful. This hotel is in an ideal location at a great price if you want to get out and see things. Easy walk to Notre Dame. We walked or took the Metro everywhere. Great little restaurants and cafes nearby. Looking forward to another visit.

Reviews.Title: “The Castex and area is all the reviews say and more.”
Reviews.Author: bandjTyneside
Reviews.Content: We selected Hotel Castex because of the area and Tripavisor and were in no way disappionted except for the weather, but it was November. The staff on arrival were friendly and very quick. The room on the third floor was larger than expected and was kept spotless during our stay, facing the street was no problem and sometimes as source of amusement. In general we would highly recommend The Castex and its staff and it is only 14 euros by taxi from Gare du Nord.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location and price for seeing Paris”
Reviews.Author: SamBrick
Reviews.Content: For an interesting, affordable, central location for seeing Paris, this hotel ticks all the boxes. I took my wife here for her 30th birthday and it was perfect. The room was very tidy, had everything we needed and the staff were very friendly and helpful. For around 100 euros you aren't going to get much in Paris and this hotel is a real bargain in this respect. The rooms were not big but then you would have to pay A LOT to have big rooms in Paris. The location was very easy to get to and from everywhere (including CDG airport and the metro). We will be back I think.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in the Marais, be sure to check if breakfast is included!”
Reviews.Author: Lizistheshizz
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved the Castex Hotel. I'm not sure that we got one of the best rooms. When we walked in, we actually burst out laughing at the size of the room. It was small, very small. But it was very cute and charming and had some nice period features, in fact we referred to the hotel as 'the castle' for our entire stay. And the beds were amazing, they were so comfortable, it was some of the best sleep I had over the holidays! I guess my only gripe about the hotel was that I wasn't sure if breakfast was included so when we checked in and the man told us what time breakfast was, I just assumed it was included. I guess that was my fault, never assume and all that. But upon checking out we were charged 24 euros for 2 breakfasts!! Pretty exorbitant for your standard croissant, yogurt, coffee set-up. If I had known it was that much (and not included) I definitely would have just gone out for food. At least we didn't go both days...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect European hotel in the Marais District”
Reviews.Author: mwhhouston
Reviews.Content: Good value for the money conveniently located to Metro and bus. The staff was very accomodating. The rooms were small but very clean. On my next trip to Paris I would stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: tiffybear24
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a year ago when traveling through France, and I loved it so much that I immediately booked with them as soon as I found out I was coming back to Paris. I will definitely stay here again when coming back to Paris... the staff was very friendly and helpful, the rooms are clean and charming, and it's located in a nice area close to the Notre Dame.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: TonyHitch
Reviews.Content: We love the Marais and Castex Hotel is near three metro stops. Nice, clean (typically small) room with nice bathroom. We usually stay nearby at St. Louis Marias, but were equally happy with this choice. We skipped the 10Euro breakfast and had coffee and croisants or tartines and confitures at Cafe de Pharo at the Bastille...then popped into the Metro for our daily adventures. Free Internet access including a complimentary lobby computer made it easy for us to check our emails. Complimentary Herald Tribune and Guardian in the lobby were nice touches.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chicago2007
Reviews.Content: I do not agree with the other positive reviews of this hotel. Yes, it's clean. Yes, it's safe. Yes, it's in a great location. No it isn't quiet. We were facing a street and was continually awaken by street noise and the garbage collectors constantly. Even with our windows closed, we had three consecutive nights of no sleep. And then because we had our windows closed, it was ungodly hot. Even the lobby was uncomfortably hot. The room is so small we didn't even have room to place our luggage anywhere. And I have traveled throughout Europe and I know a room for two usually means 2 beds put together. However, usually they make some kind of effort to actually attach them together. These beds slid apart constantly. So much for our romantic getaway. The staff spoke English but had zero recommendations on sites or food. They were basically doormen. And the last and least of my complaints was it was ugly. One small framed photo on a wall looks like they weren't even trying. For the same amount of money, we stayed at a hotel by the Eiffel Tower that looked like The Ritz!

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel in superb location”
Reviews.Author: wesglenfoodie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed at the Hotel Castex for our entire 8-day introductory trip to Paris. We loved the hotel and the Marais neighborhood, including all of the great restaurants withing walking distance. We used Bus 69 and the Metro very easily, and walked miles along the Seine every day. The front desk staff was mostly helpful, but they were not well informed about nearby eateries. They all spoke english and were very helpful re: getting to and from the airport (which was the only time we used taxis). The pictures on the Castex website were true to life. We may choose an apartment next time, primarily because there is really no way to have a light meal in our room and there is really no comfy chairs to sit in (anywhere in Paris from what we could tell). We walked often to the Pompidou Center, shopping along the way.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: GStrbk
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at Castex Hotel (4 Oct-7 Oct 2009). The hotel was perfectly located, near the metro's Bastille stop and within walking distance of numerous patissiers and cafes. Our room was facing the courtyard so the street noise wasn't a problem, but there must be a school nearby as we could hear the children early in the morning. On Sundays, there's a huge open market near the Bastille--just wish the room had a fridge to avail ourselves of the wonderful cheeses and pastries. The room was clean, the staff was helpful and the internet access was a plus. Although the "free" breakfast or discount offered w/the Rick Steves tour book didn't really pan out, I would definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel to a friend. Thanks, Trip Advisor! We planned our 10-day trip based on fellow reviewers thoughts.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel & great location”
Reviews.Author: wrenhunter
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel on a nice street very near Bastille. The street is quiet during the day, but there are a few small restaurants so there is some noise in the evening (my room faced the street). Nevertheless, with window closed & earplugs I slept like a baby. For travel, you have two Metro lines at Bastille, a short walk to the Place des Vosges at one end of the street, and a 10 minute walk to the Seine at the other. Perfect. The staff were courteous and helpful, and the room was very nice. Though traveling alone, I booked a double since it was only a few euros more. The room was neither tiny nor huge, and was clean & well maintained. The bathroom likewise, with a good, strong shower. Breakfast was OK -- croissants, cafe creme, packaged cheese & yogurt. This hotel will be top of the list for my next Paris trip.

Reviews.Title: “great "family" fun hotel”
Reviews.Author: lilbudda
Reviews.Content: Great location with an accommodating staff. Everyone was very nice to us... Only on the weekends did the cleanliness suffer, but still worth the entire trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: NWestie
Reviews.Content: A wonderful value in a great location! Staff was knowlegable and receptive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PegofSalem
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. The staff is very friendly, the location is quiet but central to dining, sightseeing and shopping. I've stayed here twice: once with my husband and once with a friend. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “All we wanted, spot on!”
Reviews.Author: ivan-coffee
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful, homely hotel. We stayed here for a Valentines break and it only added to the overall ambiance of Valentines in Paris. The rooms are clean, fresh and tidy. They do lack the space of some capitals hotel rooms, but Paris has always been compact and at this budget value, they are punching above their weight. The bathroom is clean and well stocked and serviced. The hotel's staff are friendly and helpful. And whilst their english is better than my french, they met all our needs by booking taxis, arranging tables and generally being very accommodating. the hotel is positioned well and there are about 20 decent restaurants within 500m of the hotel. The street it is on is not noisy and close enough to the metro and other main areas. There are 3 or 4 cafes at the north end of the street that serve a brilliant variety of breakfast options, so best miss out the hotels expensive offering. All in all I would stay here again and recommend it to all couples.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - room disappointing”
Reviews.Author: AyrshireScott
Reviews.Content: Very good location. However, room was on the small side and could have done with decorating. The breakfast area small with 10/15 people making it very congested.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Good value Hotel in brilliant position”
Reviews.Author: PinoAdelaide
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay in Paris, and the Castex Hotel certainly helped. The room was perfectly fine, if a little small, but Paris hotel rooms are small, unless you are paying much much more. The staff were very helpful, and the location - between the Metro stations atr the Bastille and St Paul - in my mind was perfect. The Marais seems to me to capture the essence of Paris, without being overrun by tourists, as are many other areas. We would certainly go back to the Castex Hotel if ever we are lucky enough to get back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Safe, & Quiet”
Reviews.Author: WishIWasInParis
Reviews.Content: I had heard about Hotel Castex from both Trip Advisor reviews, as well as Rick Steve's Paris book. I found this hotel to be in a very quiet, safe area, which was very important to us. The hotel also did a great job keeping the room very clean every day. This hotel is located right beside the Bastille metro line which was very convinient. The hotel was a bit pricey, and I wish the area around the hotel was more like the Rue Cler area in the 7th district, or closer to the shopping/cafe area in Marais, but then we would have been a bit further away from the Metro stop. All in all, we were pleased with our stay at Hotel Castex.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is very friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: gloriebee
Reviews.Content: The small hotel, located in the Marais, is close to the metro, shops, cafes, and the Place de Vosges. The staff was very, very friendly and helpful in every request from getting a taxi to helping locate certain shops in Paris. They really accomodated our every need. We will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Castex continues to offer excellent value & a good welcome”
Reviews.Author: GonzoBrussels
Reviews.Content: Good value in a part of Paris which is often overpriced. Quiet street, easy access, friendly staff. Rooms small but pleasant, functional and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Easy, pleasant, clean & comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Lucy108
Reviews.Content: We were grateful and surprised on arriving in Paris after a 30 hour journey to be allowed to check in to our room several hours early. This level of consideration and helpfulness was extended to us by all of the staff during our stay. The room was quiet, clean and comfortable with an excellent bathroom (having a real bathtub was an unexpected delight). Having someone in attendance at reception all the time was useful for organizing onward travel etc. Being in Le Marais and close to Bastille meant it was very convenient to get to all of the things we wanted to see in Paris. Bastille has 3 metro lines and many buses. Le Marais is full of excellent and reasonably priced restaurants and cafes. The cafe just on the corner of Rues Castex and St Antoine was one favourite; mostly locals enjoying decent and inexpensive coffee and food. They didn't speak a lot of English but were patient and good humoured with our poor French. One of the receptionists also recommended (and booked) an excellent and reasonably priced restaurant for us overlooking the Place des Vosges which was a highlight of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “best location”
Reviews.Author: travelerTampaBay
Reviews.Content: We walked everywhere from here and could always find our way back because of the Bastille column (easy to spot amid the buildings and trees). Good eating within minutes. Good train connections from Gare Lyon. And good Metro and bus practically right outside the door. Room itself was VERY SMALL, but bathroom was very accessible. Everything very clean and orderly. A good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “A good value hotel with a nice breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Midwest012
Reviews.Content: We thought this hotel was a good value, being significantly cheaper than the Rue Cler neighborhood hotel we stayed in for the first part of our hotel. The breakfast was a good value as well, and was free because we mentioned the Rick Steve's book. Unfortunately, we were in one half of a family suite set of rooms. The family on the other side of us ran in and out of their room (I think possibly their parents were in a separate suite?), and because the door locks are noisy, it made it a little hard to sleep. For the hotel, I would recommend not placing singles in the same suite as a family if possible. However, if you are traveling with your children, the unique suite arrangement would allow privacy for you but proximity to your children. You would definitely hear if they tried to sneak out of their room! The day staff understood English very well, which was helpful since our French was limited. We were disappointed in the Marais neighborhood because there was a lot of street noise when we were at the cafes, but the hotel is on an extremely quiet street just off the main boulevard, so there was no street noise at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stevemcqueenLondon
Reviews.Content: Great, cheap hotel in the best part of town in my opinion. Fantastic value.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: LovelyladyCanada
Reviews.Content: Very good value for location, quality of room and cleanliness. The only negative is that there is a lot of staff (day crew, night crew, weekend crew) and so communication for special requests is not always perfect. Nonetheless a great place, I would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, good value”
Reviews.Author: len_UG
Reviews.Content: Stayed five nights here in August 2009. Hotel is around the corner from the Bastille metro stop, so you can get to the Louvre, Notre Dame and more on the M1 without transfer. Also within a short walk are small cafes and inexpensive dining options, plus the lively Bastille restaurants. Our rooms had very strong air conditioning, a full bath and shower, and ample storage space. Wireless internet access is available and works. There's a laundry facility around the block, too. The staff is exceedingly friendly. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Castex is just the job!”
Reviews.Author: CroissantQueen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night june 2009. The staff were professional and welcoming. The room was of ample size for 2 single beds and the bathroom and particularly the shower was very nice! Our room looked out onto an unexciting courtyard but was lovely and quiet. Only a stone's throw from the metro on a useful line. Place des vosges was a 2 minute walk away. Slightly pricey with the strength of the euro but would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Dependable staff and service, nice size bathrooms and good privacy”
Reviews.Author: lynney30
Reviews.Content: We really like the fact that at this hotel you can get two rooms with a corridor connecting them (one for my husband and I and one for our 15 yr old). Each had their own bathrooms and the rooms are very reasonably priced. Nice size bathrooms (for France). They also have two rooms connected and sharing one bathroom. Beds and rooms were comfortable. It was a huge bonus to have free Internet access. The staff always gave us accurate information and were always very willing to help and answer our questions if wee need it. It's a quaint hotel with a flavor of France, and in an area that's near a lot of sites, a train station and good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: VMVUs
Reviews.Content: Small Cozy rooms, but clean and great service. Good English speaking service personell with willingness to help and guide.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for family and for romance.”
Reviews.Author: jrlooby
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in a lovely part of Paris. This was our first trip and I definitely would stay at the Castex again. We had two rooms--one for our two children and one for my husband and I. The rooms were decent size and had good size bathrooms. The service was excellent--everyone was helpful and friendly. The Marais neighborhood was wonderful. We found lots of shops, cafes, a laundromat and a grocery store all nearby. Two Metro stops were close by, and we walked to Notre Dame. A wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very cute hotel but there was so much noise in it”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte2807
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really cute, very well located, surrounded by restaurants and near the metro. The breakfast lacked another juice fruits and other things but the setting was ageeable. Being side by side with the lift made the stay very noisy, which is a real problem to me, furthermore when you have uncivilized roommates. Thus I would recommend this hotel for its qualities but I would add that you may not be able to sleep very well.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: european-traveler101
Reviews.Content: Besides being clean, we are looking for 3 characteristics in hotel rooms: quiet, air conditioned and with a strong shower. Our room at the Castex was clean but was noisy. There is no carpeting anywhere. The first time we heard our neighbors come into their rooms, we thought they were entering our room! The air conditioning was broken the first night (and made us sick with sore throats on the second night). There was no shower, but a bath tub with a hand held “telephone.” We liked the fact that our (triple) room ( room 503) had two levels (two beds upstairs and one downstairs). The luggage room is not secured. On our last day to Paris we took our luggage to the train station to get a locker.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located and professionally staffed comfortable clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2BCtravellers
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Castex Hotel on four occasions, three of which were in the same room. The rooms are very comfortable and very clean. The location is perfect for exploring Paris on foot. The staff are friendly, very helpful and conversant in English for those of us less than fluent in French. We don't consider staying anywhere else in Paris, even though there are less expensive hotels nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Location, Dated Decor”
Reviews.Author: nycyogini
Reviews.Content: I was hoping to find a cozy boutique hotel on a medieval Marais street, but booking a weekend in Paris two weeks in advance in the summer does not permit pickiness. Castex is indeed on a small, quiet street within minutes of Bastille and the metro located there and also a short walk to the area of the Marais in which I wanted to stay. The staff was friendly, though my husband speaks French. I imagine that they are used to non French speaking Americans, as Rick Steves tour groups are apparently common patrons at the Castex. I found the decor in our room to be drab and dated, with a scuffed floor. The only theme that comes to mind to describe it is "brown." We did not spend much time in our room, which was also noisy being on the ground floor, so the lack of ambiance did not bother us, but I would not recommend this particular hotel for a romantic interlude during which you plan to spend extended time in your room. It was completely serviceable as crash space for exhausted sightseers.

Reviews.Title: “great location (Metro 1-5-8 Bastille), clean, helpful staff, breakfast, ATM & PO down the street”
Reviews.Author: messro
Reviews.Content: great location in the 4th between Henry IV Blvd and Saint Antoine, everything at your doorstep, check out the hidden gem - Monoprix's market, lower level on Saint Antoine, plenty of street markets, bakeries, cafes, and the shops at Place de Voges, easy walk to Ile Saint Louis over the Pont Sully for great Glaces Berthillon

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful front desk, boring breakfast”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugMedford
Reviews.Content: The location was walking distance to transit, cafe's, river, shopping but was nice and quiet at night. The rooms are small but comfortable but you're not in your room much. The breakfast had stale rolls and croissants and no variety day to day. Our shower head broke off the wall and they couldn't fix it because it was the weekend. It would have been nice to at least get a discount. Since we had gotten one already (by mentioning our tour book) they wouldn't give us an additional discount. For customer satisfaction and inconvience it would have been nice. My husband had to hold the shower for me. The helpful front desk really made it enjoyable. Any questions we had they were very nice and helpful. Great little well situated hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location!”
Reviews.Author: brandywell
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for the budget-minded Francophile. The neighborhood, the Marais district, has a lot of color and excitement and myriad restaurants and shops to discover. Venturing forth is easy because there are at least three subway stops in the vicinity, and it is an easy walk to L'isle de la cite and ile st. louis. The rooms are small, but nicely furnished and the showers in particular were excellent. The personnel are friendly and accommodating. This is the second time I have stayed at Castex and will opt for it again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: chezBSeattle
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small but clean and comfortable. The staff was helpful, and the location was fabulous for the Metro and many favorite Paris sights.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hidden gem on quiet street steps from the Bastille”
Reviews.Author: grnkirby
Reviews.Content: Cozy hidden gem on quiet street steps from the Bastille

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mike_A_1954
Reviews.Content: Small hotel, reasonable price, WITH air conditioning that worked well. Very polite staff.

Reviews.Title: “COSY, VALUE FOR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: crazytravellerAthens
Reviews.Content: it was really cute small hotel near Bastille square close to the metro . nice rooms perfect small breakfast room. tasty breakfast. will definitely return there if go to paris again

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfortable hotel close to the tourist sites, museums etc.”
Reviews.Author: Stick422
Reviews.Content: Hotel Castex on Rue de Castex. Nice, quiet hotel close to everything that is happening in the Marais area. Two blocks from the Bastille circle with easy access to buses and metro. Very good and filling breakfast. Desk staff very nice, personable and helpful. Everyone speaks English and tries to make you feel welcome. We are a married couple in our 60s traveling with a female friend. We stayed six nights and had room 3, which is two rooms with a shared bathroom one flight up in a small building behind the hotel. You go through the hotel to a small courtyard, then the stairs to the room on other side of the courtyard. Very quiet night and day. You could sleep 2 in each room. The rooms were clean and well furnished. Very adequate for the price and our special needs being 3 people. This is a 'no frills' hotel, but it is well cared for and clean and the staff are very helpful. Breakfast is great even by US standards. Cereal, yogurt, fruit, bread, jellies, pastries, coffee, tea, milk, orange juice and expresso on request. Plenty of inexpensive restaurants in the area and easy walking distance to Picasso museum, Carnevelet museum, Pompideau center and Notre Dame. Even a Mono Prix a few block away with a well stocked grocery store. If you show them the latest Rik Steves Travel book with his recommendation you will receive a discount and breakfast will be included. All hotel rooms and bathrooms in Paris are small by US standards, so expect the same here, but it is more than adequate as a home base for visiting Paris. Public computer in the hotel lobby. Extremely fast internet access. Ask questions by email, they are very responsive. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny hotel with excellent location & staff makes for a memorable stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: tomflem
Reviews.Content: From the moment I was welcomed to the hotel upon my arrival until the instant I departed ten days later, I felt comfortable and settled in the Hotel Castex. Situated on a small street near the Place de la Bastille, the Hotel Castex offers five floors of charm and quiet in the heart of a vibrant and marvellous city. The staff speak a variety of languages and communicate their care and concern for each guest extremely well in all of them. The hotel is extremely compact but it has all the modern amenities; its free wi-fi was very important to me and always worked well. The guest-controlled air-conditioning was efficient and the windows actually opened! The modern bathroom facilities are well-designed for such a small space. I enjoyed my stay at the Hotel Castex immensely!

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful trip sandwiched between a not-so great checkin and checkout experience”
Reviews.Author: voclac
Reviews.Content: The Castex Hotel is in a great location, and though small, it's really all you need as a base for all the sight-seeing and wandering around you will be doing in Paris. Close to the Metro and in a great neighborhood, you can't beat the location. Rooms are very clean, and continental breakfast is great-a great way to start the day. Our room was small, a bit cramped and I wish I'd had the nerve to ask for a different room. But after our not-so-welcoming welcome, I was actually afraid to ask. Fortunately, the only person who was rude to us the whole trip was this one person who worked at the desk at Castex. Everyone else, including other Castex staff was wonderful. Everone was patient with our attempts to communicate, with our (extremely) limited French and mostly English. We had a wonderful time, just feel that this particular person makes it unnecessarily difficult.

Reviews.Title: “First Experience in a "Boutique" Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rinnegirl143
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently visited Paris, France in May, 2009. We stayed at the Hotel Castex for 4 nights. Based on the good reviews from Trip Advisor and the fact that is was the number 1 rated hotel in its price range in our travel book, I had high expectations for this hotel. Pleasantly, it was very conveniently located near the Bastille metro stop. There was an ATM just down the street, and also a small market around the corner. The hotel staff was very friendly. We took the advice of others on trip advisor and didn't bother with breakfast. There were plenty of places to eat in the area. The lobby of the hotel was small but charming. The elevator (lift) could barely fit the my husband and I with our luggage, but we made do. Our first impression of our room was, "wow, this is tight." Having spent two weeks in Italy, I feel like I know what people mean when they say that European hotel rooms are small. The room, yes it was small, but it also had such a bizzare shape to it. The wall around the bed curved inward, so you could barely move around the bed. There was a desk in the nook, but our overall feeling of the place was that we were staying in some sort of fortress. The floors were a clay tile, and the walls were concrete with several cracks. The bathroom was fine and clean. Our overall experience wasn't terrible, but I think it we ever went back to Paris, we would probably stay somewhere else. There was nothing so remarkable that would make us return.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped and smelled faintly of mold”
Reviews.Author: writer48
Reviews.Content: The hotel may have some fine rooms, but 604 (on the first floor) is not one of them. Great location and some fine staff, save one who could barely conceal his scorn for anyone who dared ask a question. Breakfast was spare by French hotel standards.

Reviews.Title: “Spotlessly clean, comfy beds, good location, very friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: babalala
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed one night as planned - booked on the internet with ease - all staff were extremely helpful and friendly - the hotel and our ropm were very clean - the bathroom spotlessly so - ours was on the top floor at the front with interesting view -it was quite small but this wasn't a problem as we were not in it for long during the day- I gather rooms at the back were larger - the surrounding area was interesting to walk around - particularly St Paul Village and La Place des Vosages - all in all I would recommend it

Reviews.Title: “A nice little hotel in an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: AlimaLondon
Reviews.Content: Rooms are not massive but they very clean, well-equipped and quiet. The breakfast is a bit basic and not really worth the money so I would recommend trying one of the many cafes nearby instead.
