Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Syd2040
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Castex in Paris, and was booked without hesitation. The hotel's location is great, with an easy stroll to the Bastille metro station, and an easy walk to the Marais and beyond. The service is very good, with English spoken freely. Will definitely stay again when next in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ticket&passport
Reviews.Content: First stay at the Castex, and I'd definitely go back. The rooms are small but well laid out and very comforrtable. The bathrooms are good sized and mine had a real shower - with a curtain - over the big bathtub. The hotel is in a great location in the Marais. Just a short walk from the Bastille Metro, and on a nice quiet street. Less than a block to a wide variety of good cafes, and just a nice walk to various sites. Breakfast is a nice buffet - definitely worth the 10 euros - and a pleasant way to meet other people at the hotel. The only negative was that the free wi-fi was a bit spotty in my room. Sometimes it worked great, other times not.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Tatocarioca
Reviews.Content: The reception team is very helpful and they speak very good english. They helped us looking for restaurants and parking. The location is perfect: two blocks far from Bastile metro station, 5 minutes walking to reach Ile St-Louis and Notre-Dame and 10 min to Quartier Latin. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “I keep returning to the Castex!”
Reviews.Author: Teresa89
Reviews.Content: This was my third time at the Castex and as always I was not disappointed. Close to the lively Bastille and the elegant Marais and there is the metro stop Bastille and also plenty of bus options . It is close enough to walk to all the major sites and also plenty of great restaurants and shopping near-by. The rooms are charming and comfortable and the thing that makes this hotel stand are the super friendly and professional staff. I am already planning my return trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: Twosteins
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for our first adventure in Paris for 5 nights at the Castex. An overall good experience. Highly recommended for a home base to sightsee and enjoy what Paris has to offer, and being away from the hustle of the Champs Elysees or more touristy areas. This felt like a real neighborhood. The room was average -- it was very small as we expected, so we generally didn't hang out there much. For a 5 night stay it would have been nice to have some relaxation in the room, but alas we did not go to Paris to hang out in the hotel I suppose. So it was perfect. Rick Steves recommended it, and with his book we got great discounts and free breakfast -- you must buy Rick's book (2009 France) either way, but the Castex is a can't beat deal if you have his book for the discounts (4th night free, free breakfast for 2 -- a 10 euro per person per day value). Generally a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “very good quality/price”
Reviews.Author: sveTervuren
Reviews.Content: Nice location, quiet room, good service, original internal garden.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Massimo1
Reviews.Content: The Castex is small, tidy, and has character without being pretentious. The Castex, unbelievably, is on a quiet street just 2 blocks from the Bastille which is normally quite active with restaurants, cafes, shops, nightlife, and cars. The hotel is also on the edge of the Marais, so it's a short walk to the features in that area, too. The price was average for the area. The rooms are a bit on the small side, but they are pleasantly, if simply, decorated. The bathroom was of good size. The windows were double-glazed. I was on the back side of the hotel, so it was really quiet. The view was toward other buildings, but as there was the tiny courtyard below, it wasn't claustrophic. The room had individual climate control. The staff on the desk were all pleasant, though my interaction was rather limited, not being a first time traveler to Paris. The elevator was big enough for 2 or 3 people with luggage. The biggest plus of all was free wireless internet access. The other hotels I looked into around there in that class all charged heinous fees for wi-fi. My only two negatives are 1) though the bed was comfy, the mattress was slumping and due for replacement and 2) there was a mildew smell from the bathroom. I think the problem was poor ventilation and there's probably not a good fix for that. Anyway, with the door closed, it wasn't a bother. I have to say, having read tons of reviews of Paris hotels, is that what most people fail to note about central Paris is that so many of the hotels are buildings that were converted or were hotels long before people came to expect huge American-style room spaces. You can find those large rooms, but be prepared to pay for them. If you are going to go on a low budget, you will normally get a small room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: koolkids
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Excellent location a few minutes walk from the metro station (Bastille). Breakfast was fine, but no chocolate croissants :( For the money you can get a better experience at one of the nearby cafes. Our room (on the top floor) was quite small, but clean, warm, and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: giromondo
Reviews.Content: We arrived after 10PM and experienced one of the worst hotel gaffes - we were given a key to a room that was already occupied (by sleeping guests no less). The hotel staff did rectify the situation promptly and assigned us a new room. Best features of hotel: great location, on a quiet street, near Metro Bastille, 5 minutes walk to Place des Vosges, Ile St Louis, and many good restaurants. Nice bathroom with modern shower, good water pressure. Helpful, courteous staff. Clean. Areas for improvement: check-in/check-out process (it's all very manual), room decor and furnishings (dated). Rooms are quite cozy, but this is typical for Paris hotels. Seems to be a favorite of Rick Steves (majority of guests were with a Rick Steves tour group).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Castex”
Reviews.Author: Patrick_VL
Reviews.Content: We stayed for just two nights last December. Our party had three rooms. All rooms were clean and comfortable with newly remoddeled bathrooms. The number 3 is at the back up one flight of stairs, great if you want some quiet time in busy Paris. Nice breakfast (much more than just your croisant and coffee) buffet for 10 euro. Patrick Bay Area, CA

Reviews.Title: “Enchanting Castex”
Reviews.Author: KKlein25
Reviews.Content: The Castex Hotel is charming and absolutely stunning! Rooms are full of character and are more comfortable than we expected; the beds and shower were better than mine at home! The only suggestions for improvement would be to have a bit more information available in the room about the area and directions, as well as an alarm clock. The breakfast is convenient, but nothing special so not really worth the price. That being said, the Castex made my stay in Paris truly enjoyable and if I ever go back I will not hesitate to book there again.

Reviews.Title: “Warm, cozy, French, with great location and value”
Reviews.Author: ClevelandWanderer
Reviews.Content: This was a great find! Nice hotel in a great location at a very reasonable price. The hotel was clean and cozy, with impecccable service. The breakfast was good - baguettes, croissants, jams, cheese, fruit, cereal, juice, coffee, tea, and yogurts - plenty to get you started for a day of sightseeing. It normally costs 10Euro/day, but be sure to get your free breakfast with a Rick Steves book. This saved us 20 Euros a day! Also, the price I got on their website was quite a bit less than their posted double rate. We had a double for 110 Euros (and with free breakfasts b/c we had the Steves book). We visited in December, so the fireplace in the main room made for a nice place to hang out, play card, read the paper. There is also a computer for internet in the lobby. The hotel offers free wireless, but the service did go out a few times during the 5 days we were there. The hotel is a very short walk from the Bastille metro stop (less than 2 minute walk). We were also able to walk from the Gare de Lyon station (where the Air France bus from the airport stops) to the hotel easily (about 10 minutes), but you could also take the metro. The cafe at the corner of Rue Castex and Rue St. Antoine was also great and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Tres Bon 3-Star Hotel in The Marais”
Reviews.Author: KittyChan
Reviews.Content: Le Marais is my favorite part of Paris, and I always try to stay there when I visit. That can be a challenge, as there are not many good, affordable hotels right in the Marais. My most recent Marais stay was at Hotel Castex, and I was very pleased with it. It's a solid three-star property with comfortable rooms, great location, and good prices. I paid about 115 euros/night for a double-bed (the usual-for-France two single beds pushed and sheeted together) room that I booked directly on the hotel's easy-to-use website. Location: Hotel Castex is only two very short blocks (maybe 100m) from the Place Bastille, but it's on a short, quiet street. It's on the eastern edge of the Marais, which is compact enough that walking from one end of the 4th Arrondisment to the other is no problem. And the nearby Bastille metro stop is great for getting easily to other parts of the city. As with any central Paris neighborhood, there are plenty of shops, cafes, and restaurants within the immediate vicinity of the hotel. Cafe Le Rempart, at the end of Rue Castex, has excellent and cheap coffee. There is a Monoprix supermarket nearby, on Rue St. Antoine, as well as a very good wine and spirits shop called Nicholas. Hotel itself: The lobby is pleasant, with comfortable furniture, an internet-connected computer for guests' use, and someone on duty 24 hours. I didn't use any of the hotel's few services or have breakfast, so I leave to other reviewers to comment on those features. I did, however, ask the day clerk to arrange a wake-up call, which he did as I watched. (Like many hotels, Castex uses an automated wake-up call system, and I received my call at the exact requested time.) I spoke French with the various front-desk clerks, so I didn't discern their English capabilities. Rooms: As others have noted -- and as is the case in most European cities -- the rooms are small but well appointed and comfortable. My double room, which was on the 2nd floor, faced the street. The windows opened, and I was able to keep my beverages (very) cold on the mini-ledge with a metal railing -- it was the same size and space as a beverage shelf in a large refridgerator door. The bed was comfortable, even with the slight ridge where the two twin beds met under the fitted cover sheet. The room had a decently sized flat-screen TV with a limited selection of mostly French channels -- although it did also have CNN. Wireless internet access in the room was free and pretty quick and reliable most of the time. The bathroom was spotless and sufficiently roomy, with a full-size bathtub-shower combo. The room's decor was fine: pleasant and unremarkable. I did not hear much noise from the street or other rooms. In sum, I recommend Hotel Castex as a very good mid-priced hotel in Paris's most charming neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “I've Stayed Here Twice Now”
Reviews.Author: 2rosie
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel last year based on a Rick Steves' recommendation and returned again this year - both times in early December. The location is great. The rooms are tiny, but clean and have everything I expected and need - comfy bed, windows that open, heat, desk with electrical outlet, free wifi, phone, hair dryer. A unique feature of the hotel is that two individual rooms are connected by a little hallway with its own door, which would be nice for a family or individuals traveling together. There's an elevator, a computer available for guests' use in the lobby, and you can have breakfast downstairs in the morning. My only complaint is that the night desk clerk didn't follow though on my request for a wake-up call, but fortunately, I had set my travel alarm clock, too. The street, Castex, is only one block long, so if you take a taxi, you might need to show a taxi driver where it is on a map. I'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Castex”
Reviews.Author: VoyageurVoyageur
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel through Trip advisor and it was great. I booked a single room and was pleasently surprised at its size. You could comfortably sleep 2 in the room and it was very clean. Also, its location was great: 2 minute walk to the metro and tons of cafes, restaurants and shops in the Marais area. I would definitely go there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mfoundas
Reviews.Content: After checking out Trip Advisor etc, we decided to stay at the Castex Hotel ,which ended up being a great little place, and in a fantatstic location, close to the Metro, Night life, and good walking distance to all the tourist attractions. Room was fine but small....typical Paris, but clean and great shower and bed ...all in all, very happy with our stay ...oh yeah and friendly staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Good Price!”
Reviews.Author: LowCountryIslander
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Castex on a Rick Steves group tour. I arrived a day before the tour started and the hotel staff could not have been nicer. They were very accommodating and I was able to check in a little before the posted check-in time. I was in a first floor room at the front of the building but since this is a quiet street, noise was not a factor. The room was small compared to American standards, but very clean and comfortable, afterall, much time wasn't really spent i the room. The location was the best part of this hotel, just on the edge of the Marais and only a few blocks from the Place de la Bastille and a metro stop for easy access to all of Paris. The breakfast selection was a nice variety of cheeses, yogurts, fruits, and croissants, in the cute little basement breakfast room. I would definitely stay again on any return trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: eurotraveller01
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location, near a metro, within walking distsnce to the Seine and Notre Dame Cathedral. The staff were extremely friendly and were always willing to answer our questions or give recommendations. The rooms were clean and not as nearly as small as we thought they would be. I would recommend asking for a room at the rear of the hotel since the street can be a little noisy early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “We highly recommend the Castex Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AfterDinnerMint
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have asked for a better hotel de charme. The location was excellent (Marais); the staff were exceedingly helpful; the bathroom was spacious, modern, and spotless; and the price very reasonable, especially for such a wonderful neighborhood. We highly recommend the Castex Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: Oregonnoichigoichie
Reviews.Content: My three sons ( ages 15, 19, and 23) and I enjoyed our rooms and the neighborhood. The location is great and the staff were very helpful. We hope we can stay there again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Home in the Marais”
Reviews.Author: DandKMn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Castex hotel several times over the past decade. The combination of good rates, great service, and top, top location makes this our choice of stay in Paris again and again.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Paris...!”
Reviews.Author: Raj95
Reviews.Content: An excellent location. It was a Saturday when I checked in, and was transiting from New Delhi to Brussles for a tax conference, hence stayed at Castex for a day. The receptionist was quite friendly and helpful (I had to bother her atleast three times in one hour to know where I could get an adaptor for my laptop, a place to eat and nearest metro etc.).The hotel is well kept - I got a (single) room at the top floor, with a spacious shower, though the room itself was small (and the view was non existent), to say the least, cramped- but then, I had come prepared for that- after all, its Paris! The metro is hardly a minute's walk, so are eating joints (what variety!!), pubs and the like. Overall, an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Marais area is a good location”
Reviews.Author: Huisache
Reviews.Content: A very European hotel in the Marais a very European part of Paris. If you like to walk it's within walking distance of many sights such as Notre Dame and also close to the Bastille Metro Station for sights further away like the Eiffel Tower and Rodin Museum. The neighborhood has many sidewalk cafes. The room and breakfast were quite good. I'd stay again. It's a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, superb location in trendy neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: MaartjeZwolle
Reviews.Content: Although we had a lot of rain when staying in Paris, we loved this hotel. The room was very nice and clean. Quiet as well (ours was at the back, overlooking the patio). The room is not very big, but a good size compared to other Paris hotels. The location is an absolut blast! Only downside was the fact that we left our electronical toothbrush by accident in our hotel room. We e-mailed, but did not receive any reaction if it was found at all! Service could have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and friendly people”
Reviews.Author: ScottyD34
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week-long trip to Paris where we stayed at the Hotel Castex. We were part of a tour group during the week and extended our stay through the weekend. The people who work the front desk of the hotel are all very friendly and helpful. Our flight arrived early in the morning on our first day but they got a room ready for us by 10:00 am so we could rest a little. They were very patient about speaking English with us and also helped us with our French during the week. There is free wireless available for a laptop and one computer in the lobby. Regarding the rooms, they are very small, especially for two people. If you have a lot of luggage you will have space issues. But if you are there to see Paris and only need a room for sleep you will be fine. The maid service was much better during the week than it was on the weekend. But the room and bathroom were kept clean. The bed was made, trash emptied, and towels changed out daily. There was a noise in the wall that seemed to come from the air conditioning unit but we were so tired at night that we adapted and slept through it. I recommend that the noise be fixed however. The hallways and rooms are tight so you will hear people coming and going in the hall. We were only awakened one night by a loud neighbor who came in very late in a tipsy condition. The other nights we slept comfortably. The hotel is on a side street so there is limited street noise at night if you are a light sleeper. Regarding location, the hotel is very close to the Bastille metro stop and you can go anywhere in the city from there. The Marais district has many places to see and wander through like the Jewish quarter and Place de Voges. There are plenty of restaurants and cafes in the area and a grocery store within a five minute walk from the hotel. No matter when we went out we always felt very safe in the area. If you are looking for a hotel at a comparably good price, and are okay with small rooms, I would recommend the Hotel Castex. If we ever did go to Paris again we would stay there if we were going to be in the city most of the time. You will be in a good location with very friendly people who are willing to help you during your visit.

Reviews.Title: “Small is Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: amclellan
Reviews.Content: very friendly and helpful staff. we paid 150 per night for double room with no breakfast included. this is probably average for paris and the location was very good as we could walk to the Marais area for dinner and in fact we could easily walk to the historic centre (Notre Dame etc). but the room was tiny tiny tiny - ok we had come from 10 days in a 4 room apartment - but here the room was so narrow that you could hardly squeeze past the bed - the length of which nearly equalled the width of the room. bars on Rue St Antoine for breakfast were VERY hit and miss - expensive - I mean 4 Euros for a coffee - even in Dublin they wouldn't DARE charge 4 Euros for a coffee. there was a fantastic little bakery on Rue St Antoine but the coffee was terrible there. they had delicious pastries and also we learned quickly to stock up there in the morning with the great value and delicious sandwich baquettes (3.50 Euro) Great places to eat in the Marias area include Les Philosophes, 28 Rue Vielle du Temple - friendly staff, very popular place but you can always get a table if you wait a couple of minutes - you have to try the confit de canard and the chocolate mousse. portions are generous so you may need to dissolve it away with an armagnac afterwards. We couldnt escape this place without parting with 70 euros minimum (with one bottle of wine included). Another fantastic if eccentric place was the Cafe des Musees on rue de Turenne (just off Rue des Francs Bourgeois) - it is worth waiting for the table, and it is worth waiting for the wine, and it is worth waiting a long time for the food. I had the entrecote of my life - the steak was bigger than most Irish towns and so tender I thought I would die. the armagnac that the maitre d' served me was about 15 years old and so fantastic i can't even think about now that I am back in Ireland with the rain peeing down on our heads. enjoy - you lucky [----]

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: traveler90NewYork
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Castex. The rooms were well kept and wi-fi was a plus. The staff was very friendly. The TVs could have had more channels and our bed was too twin beds pushed together instead of a double bed which was slightly uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rmaballet
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 3 nights and it was very nice! It is only one stop on the metro from the train station and then a 5 minute walk from the metro station. The room was quite small but very clean and up to date. There are a lot of cafes nearby and a great restaurant that a hotel employee suggested. They also provided free internet which was great. The metro in Paris is very easy to navigate so we used it to get everywhere. 2 stations are no more than 5 minutes walk from the hotel. Nice little hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, marvelous bathrooms, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: dewpilot
Reviews.Content: The rooms are not large but were clean upon arrival and cleaned daily, with supplies replenished. With excellent showers, the bathrooms are bright and have apparently been recently refurbished to the highest standard. Air conditioning in the rooms is more than adequate to combat the summer heat of the city. The elevator was sufficiently large for 3-5 people (or 2 people with luggage) and fast enough in operation. The hotel decor tends toward a Spanish motif, with attractive beige wall colors and rust-colored floor tiles. Although the hard surfaces reflect sound and magnify noise in the hallways, we heard nothing from adjacent rooms. The staff were friendly, ready to help, and very capable of communicating in English to help resolve problems. Located three blocks from the Bastille Metro station (as well as a stop for L'Open hop-on hop-off tour bus), it is suited well for tourists spending a few days in the city. We would choose it again without question. Cincinnati Travelers

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: alesmond
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very centrally located by the Bastille and Metro. The rooms were very small and clean but the bathrooms were modern. The only drawback is that you can hear everything around you in all the surrounding rooms. A couple of nights I thought my neighbors were in my bathroom and hall!! Otherwise, very friendly and helpful. Maid service was immediate, just leave for breakfast. I would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Duo Axial, simply awesome”
Reviews.Author: g35xer
Reviews.Content: Location, Location, Location!!! Although the single rooms were very, very small (8'X12' or so), the double rooms were of a standard size us in Canada are accustomed to (there were 5 of us in our party). The hotel just underwent renovations, and from the lobby, to the lounge and to the rooms, you could swear that Debbie Travis was the project manager; fresh, modern, audacious colours, the works. The staff was very friendly and helpful as well. Now, back to the location: right in the heart of Paris, less than a 10 minute walk from Ile St-Louis and the famous Notre-Dame cathedral. Plenty of little bistro's and cafes everywhere. The 4th district is also the gay district, but that didn't bother any of us as this wasn't why we were there in the first place. Would I return? I'm actually planning on bringing my wife next year and I won't look anywhere esle but the Duo Axial. From my perspective, it was simply perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasure to stay at Hotel Castex”
Reviews.Author: ESussex
Reviews.Content: The website is well designed and easy to use. Staff are courteous and helpful. The room was very clean with a large comfortable bed - (I have back problems and hate uncomfortable beds). It was a pleasant surprise to find my room opened onto a delightful courtyard where I could have a cigarette - something I thought I would not be able to do in the hotel since the non-smoking regulations. Situated centrally, a short walk from the Bastille the hotel was relatively quiet being just off the main roads. A definite pleasure to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: e_onthego
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Castex for a week in mid-Februrary 2008. Overall, I was very pleased with the stay and would recommend it to others. The room was decent, and most importantly, clean. As with most rooms in Europe, it's smaller than what most US folks are used to - but I wasn't there to spend time in the room. It was clean, comfortable, had a small safe and the bathrooms were modern. My room faced the street on the 2nd floor. Those sensitive to noise might request a room on the backside - but this is central Paris, and I don't think there is anywhere those of us from suburbia would consider "quiet". The staff was fine and there is a computer in the lobby to do some research or check e-mail. As for location, I thought it was fine. It's close enough to get just about anywhere with a 10 minute walk & a Metro ride. In fact, I walked and used the Metro all week. There are 3 Metro lines at the Bastille and a 4th line just down Blvd Henry IV. These would get you to most of the tourist sights in town. But if you don't want to or can't walk, you might want to look for something closer to the sights you want to see. I took advantage of the breakfast about three times during the week. This was mainly for convenience. The spread was decent, but for the 10euro charge, be hungry - or I'd suggest hitting the bakery just around the corner on Rue St Antoine (they also start putting out sandwiches about 10am for you late risers). There are also several little markets within a block or 2 where you could stock up on some drinks or snacks as needed. And as long as I'm talking food - I very highly recommend Cafe LeReveil just around the corner on Blvd Henry IV. I ate there 3 times - as did some others I met at the hotel. It was better than Bofiger - also nearby - and the staff there was very friendly. Lastly, price - paid about $150/night. Researched comparable hotels, and this was right in the range. Enjoy your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but I got a noisy room.”
Reviews.Author: DubBoy
Reviews.Content: I agree with most of the reviews here - yes, it was nice, clean, comfortable (if a little small) and the staff were nice. However, I had one big problem with my room. The sound insulation was terrible - I did not get any sleep because the person in the next room was entering and leaving and moving around the room during the night. Again the cleaning lady in the morning walking around the corridor woke me up when I finally got to sleep. These people were not making much noise - it was just that I could hear everything they did and I am not a light sleeper. I think I had room 301. Fortunately I only stayed 1 night. It is not worth 150 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Girlygirlice
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my husband for 3 nights and we loved it. The hotel is at a great location, the rooms are very small but clean and cosy and the staff very friendly and they speak good english (many people in paris refuse to speak english even though the can, so I recommend either you ask them in french if they speak english or if english is not your first language that you start speaking your language when you are asking them something, that way the french usualy start talking english to you)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: gladfin
Reviews.Content: We needed a reasonable hotel close to the Opera Bastille and booked this one in trepidation, since it was cheap. We were very pleasantly surprised. The rooms are not large, but they are very quiet, and the bathrooms totally modernised - and everything spotlessly clean. There are one or two rooms at the rear of the courtyard which are very pleasant. The hotel staff could not be more helpful. Breakfast is a bit disappointing but no complaints given the price. (Opposite the hotel there is a great, relaxed Italian restaurant which we will visit again) The hotel is really very well situated: the metro is extremely close and all central tourist attractions are five or six stops away. We have already booked our next stay at the Castex.

Reviews.Title: “I would not hesitate to come back”
Reviews.Author: hattiep
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel based on the review in the Rick Steves book and have no regrets and in fact will come back. The staff was exceptionally helpful, the breakfast was heavenly (and cheap), and the area so lovely I would highly recommend it. Yes the rooms are rather small, but it was impeccably clean and comfortable. You are in Paris, who spends much time in their hotel room? The boulangerie on Rue St Antoine is worth visiting daily and I would also recommend Bofinger's for dinner and be sure to check out L'As du Fallafel in the Marais for the best falafel you will ever taste.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lalibrarian
Reviews.Content: We really loved the Castex. The staff were so kind and welcoming and our room was immaculate. I was grateful that there was a shower curtain rather than the small glass partition that is often found in European showers. The location was great and we saved 10 euro a day by eating breakfast (in our case, just a croissant/tartine and a grand creme) at the cafe, Le Rampart, on the corner of the rue Castex and the rue St-Antoine instead of eating at the hotel. The bed was wonderful and far above what you might expect at this price (it is a king bed made by combining two twins--but they are joined solidly). We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Better than most, in fact, a little gem”
Reviews.Author: TheMag
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely perfect for a short stay. Our room was spotlessly clean, there is an elevator, which helps with heavy luggage. The street is quiet at night and literally around two corners from the Place des Vosges. Walking distance to all the sites in the Marais as well as Notre Dame and the Isle de la Cite. The staff is friendly and very helpful. We like the hotel and prefer it to other Paris lodgings we have been to. We will certainly book again for our next visit. M. and H. Kilian Limehouse, ON. Canada

Reviews.Title: “You can find better”
Reviews.Author: visionlaura
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in about 10 hotels in the Marais of varying quality. Although the Castex is in a prime location and has a very spacious room, it REEKED of smoke. You can find cheaper and less smokey just a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: eurostartraveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in the perfect location . We walked nearly everywhere. It was clean, pleasantly decorated and although the room was small (aren't they all in Paris?) The bathroom was well fitted out and the lift took 5 people. The staff were pleasant and helpful and the cafe on the corner of Rue Castex and Rue Saint Antoine did an excellent breakfast and evening meal.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend even though I had a problem...”
Reviews.Author: Scottie23
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms at this hotel but there was a problem with one of them so the hotel had to re-locate me to one of their sister properties. It really tells you something about a place when they handle a problem this well. The woman could not have been sweeter, she told me about the problem and offered to pay for a taxi to the other hotel since it was about a 25 minute walk (and taxis back and forth if necessary since our friends were still staying here), printed maps out for me and apologized more times than I could count. Since my friends were able to stay there, we got to see their room which was very nice and they really enjoyed their stay. There are some similar 3-star hotels on the other side of Rue de Rivoli and a few blocks in the direction of St. Paul Metro that are just as nice and a bit cheaper that I prefer because they are more centrally located in Le Marais, but this place is about a 5-10 minute walk from those and is quite lovely and reasonably priced (and you won't find a nicer or more helpful receptionist if the woman we dealt with is there when you are) so I would highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Archer17
Reviews.Content: I have been to Paris twice. First in 2004 and second in 2006. I stayed over 5eme and stayed at hotels ranked here on Tripadvisor. I decided to stay over the Marais, because I realized I haven't explored the right bank at all. After reading a few travel books and researching the internet, I decided to stay at Castex Hotel. It's my Mom's first Paris visit and I wanted her to enjoy it. I totally enjoyed the atmosphere of the Marais and highly recommend staying at Castex Hotel. As a matter of fact, I prefer this hotel over the 2 hotels i previously stayed at (which I also found from tripadvisor). The hotel is about 1 1/2 blocks away from the Bastille Metro(Saint Antoine exit). The hotel is walkable in my opinion to Notre Dame, Pompadour (I obviously like to walk). Don't forget to checkout Amorino (good Gelato) right in front of the Pompadour. I will definitely stay at the Castex Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and a waste of money”
Reviews.Author: Wolffgroup
Reviews.Content: HORRIBLE AND FILTHY- Didn't anyone check their beds? I don't understand these other reviews.. Yes the bathroom was ok, but the sheets were dirty, and I had to change them myself since there was no staff available! We slept in our clothes, and couldn't wait to leave . I think Rick Steve should take it out of his book, although they do book his tours through this place. Tiny dirty rooms, peeling paint, bad locks, and terrible breakfast. A total waste of time. Almost ruined our first experience of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: tell_me_how
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Catex. The hotel is very convenient to the Bastille metro station and a short stroll from Notre Dame and the Seine. The area is very lively right in Marais but the Rue Castex is very quiet. It is close to many restuarants. The room we had was comfortable, clean and charming. The consierge was very helpful and friendly. This was such a lovely spot to stay in Paris for great value, I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value-Great location”
Reviews.Author: LvanL
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at this hotel and were very impressed. The front desk staff (24 hours) were friendly and helpful. The room #504 was small but spotless and quiet (it overlooks a rooftop courtyard and is away from traffic noise). The bed was comfortable (2 singles pushed together). We really appreciated the free WIFI and internet. The air-conditioning, while not needed while we were there as we had a cool, rainy spell of weather, kept the room cool and the air circulating. The breakfasts were included for us as we used Rick Steve's France book for a discount (stay 5 nights get the 5th night free and all breakfasts). I found that the breakfasts were just right with enough choices. The hotel's location was perfect--close to Bastille metro stop and within walking distance of Notre Dame and many other sites. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Neighbourhood, Fair Value”
Reviews.Author: BCBoy3
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews, and was not disappointed. As in all Paris hotels, the room was very small with almost no storage space. We had a room with a bath, not a shower, and by Paris standards the bathroom was reasonably sized. All the fixtures were very modern and in excellent shape. The bath itself was large and deep by North American standards. The room was in excellent condition and the flooring was a very attractive tile, rather than the usual hotel carpet. The lobby was well appointed and the computer in the lobby that provided free internet access was new and worked fine. (If you are not used to French keyboards, beware!) I did not breakfast at the hotel, so cannot comment on that aspect. Given the large number of excellent cafés in the neighbourhood, especially along Boul. St. Antoine, you can undoubtedly save money by breakfasting out. I found the front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. I booked on-line and experienced no difficulty with the reservations or any other aspect of the booking. I think it is a fair value for the price. Paris is expensive, and this hotel has an excellent location. It’s very close to a metro station and it’s in a very good walking neighbourhood. I have stayed, recently, in a perfectly acceptable hotel in the 5th arrondissment that was much cheaper, so if saving money is your prime consideration, you can do better. But given the location, and the quality, it’s fair value and I would go back again without qualms.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Gem”
Reviews.Author: TexTraveler1
Reviews.Content: My partner and I highly recommend this charming hotel located near the Bastille Metro stop. The staff members were extraordinary - they were completely helpful in every way. Even though the breakfast was not included in the room rate, we found the breakfasts in the hotel dining room to be very generous and a good value. As with many European hotels the rooms were very small and with minimal lighting and storage space. Baths too were small, but very clean and well equipped. This is an excellent find - and a real value in an expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Great neighborhood location; nice, basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: dexdar
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice once in 2001 and once in 2007 through Rick Steves tours. Hotel Castex is in a great area with nearby boulangeries, cafes and more. It is also close to the Bastille metro stop. The rooms have been renovated since I first stayed. The removations seemed to have concentrated on the bathrooms, which are small but nice. The rooms are clean and the staff is friendly. I'd stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints - comfortable little hotel”
Reviews.Author: christineb
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Paris and I was celebrating my 60th birthday on Bastille Day. As I had no idea what of part of Paris to stay I eventually decided that near the Place de la Bastille might be appropriate. After asking friends, reading extensively about small hotels and wearing out the reviews on Trip Advisor I finally decided to stay at the Hotel Castex. I booked direct with the hotel and had to pay 148 euros per night - but then it was the start of the French holidays. We followed the hotel's directions and took the bus to the Gare de Lyon and then the metro to Bastille. (If you are planning on using the metro I would recommend buying a 3day, 5day or whatever pass. You can then hop on and off metros at will.) As other reivewers have warned - take the rue St Antoine exit. We arrived well before midday but there was no problem leaving our bags whilst we started our sightseeing. The weather had hotted up with a bang and it was about 34 - 35 degs C so when we opened the door to our room the cool temperature of the air conditioning was very welcoming. As warned by other reviewers the room was small. As I had no previous experience of Paris I was not able to compare it, but it didn't turn out to be a problem. The beds were actually 2 x 3ft beds pushed together and were extremely comfortable. The room was clean and the bathroom was reasonably modern. As a previous reviewer (BobH) - we also stayed in room 504. Bob stated that his TV didn't work and there wasn't a proper showhead. However, he stayed there in October 2006 and they have now put a fixture on the wall for the shower head and the TV worked fine. The big thing for us was the airconditioning in Paris in July. The main thing that bothered my husband was the lack of fire escape. There was a 30 minute fire resistant door outside our room and the next room (like a small lobby) but there was absolutely nowhere to go apart from the stairs. If there was a fire on the stairs the only way down was out of the 5th floor window and there was nowhere to jump to apart from the ground. The hotel staff were very agreeable and I had e-mailed beforehand asking about somewhere locally to eat on my birthday. It was suggested we went to Bofinger just round the corner and the hotel booked this for us. I had read various reviews about Bofinger and some none too flattering. However, we couldn't fault the service or the food and when the waitress brought my dessert there was a firework in it for my birthday. We really liked the Marais district - we felt very safe at night walking around. It is within easy walking distance of Notre Dame, which I thought was absolutely fantastic - far better "in the flesh" than photographs or films. You couldn't starve in the Marais - there are numerous cafes, bars, restaurants, bistros etc etc - even a supermarket! The Place des Vosges is also just round the corner and also St Pauls church which is part of the old St Pauls Village. We enjoyed our stay at the Castex and would consider staying there again, but might ask for a lower room (not so far to jump if there's a fire !!!!)

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: MCTozzo
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Castex for 4 nights. Originally it was supposed to be 2 nights, but the Pratic Hotel I was booked at for two didn't have a room for me when I arrived. The staff at the Castex was able to extend my stay so that I was not stranded. (Never stay at the Pratic) The hotel is a little further away from the main tourist attractions that I had originally thought, but is two short blocks away from the Bastille metro station and is in a wonderful neighborhood. We found a fantastic restaurant in the neighborhood called the Cafe Creme and highly recommend it. The room was really really small, but its Paris and hopefully you won't spend much time in there anyway. But, the staff was outstanding. Spoke excellent English and was extremely helpful in every way. The breakfast was a littly skimpy and probably not worth the 10 euros it costs. I would really just suggest walking to a nearby bistro and there are plenty. There is free computer with internet access in the lobby. The bathroom was new and modern. First time in Paris so I can't compare to others, but overall, very pleased with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice!”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirlRidesAgain
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Castex for three nights and were completely satisfied. We were in room 201 which is on the street side. Because it is a small side street, the traffic noise was minimal at night (or we were too worn out to hear anything). The room was very clean with plenty of blankets and pillows available. We had a double bed which is two twins pushed together. The bed was very comfortable. The big soaking tub (with shower) was great after a long day of site seeing. Bring your Rick Steves guidebook and get a free breakfast. Even without the book the breakfast is worth the 10 Euros. It was the only place I got a regular, American size cup of coffee. There was plenty of bread, fruit, yogurt and cereal to keep you going the whole day. As others have mentioned, the location is ideal with easy access to the metro. Its just minutes away from all the major sites. There is a computer in the lobby with free internet access. This was great for checking email. I'm not positive, but I think the entire hotel was wireless.

Reviews.Title: “Small but adequate”
Reviews.Author: delahey
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was in a good location near the Bastille, just a few blocks away from the Metro. It was mentioned in Rick Steves' Paris guide and if you mention that book when making your reservation, the hotel gives you a discount on the room and includes breakfast. We usually stay in more expensive hotels, but since our daughter and her girlfriend were with us and we needed two rooms, we decided to economize. The room was very clean but very tiny - absolutely no extra room and it was difficult to find a place for your luggage. I wouldn't want to stay here for longer than 3 nights, but it served our purpose this trip and was definitely satisfactory. The bed was very comfortable and the staff accomodating. It was just about what we had expected for a three star hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: girlsmom25
Reviews.Content: We just spent 5 nights at the Castex and were very pleased with it. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We had connecting rooms with our kids which gave us alot of space. The rooms were clean, the maids even folded clothes for us. We had a nice little breakfast every day. Close to many shops and places to eat and two metro stops, we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: *jane_08*
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Castex in mid January 2007. We had booked the room through their website several weeks prior. We had booked a twin room, and on arrival, were given what could more accurately be called a small two bedroom apartment! The staff were really friendly, helpful, and had good English. The hotel is located very close to metro stations, however the main tourist attractions can also be reached by foot if you don't mind a walk. It's also nice and close to cafes and most importantly, patisseries! Our stay at this hotel was overall very enjoyable and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Small place, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Eskot
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Castex as part of a Rick Steves tour. This hotel is in a PERFECT location in Paris - great access to the metro and near an easy-to-find landmark (the Bastille), good cafes and restaurants all around, walking distance to Ile St Louis, a little further walk to the Notre Dame. The staff spoke English well enough and were courteous. When going, understand that the rooms will be very, very small - big enough for your bed and your luggage shoved in the corner - but know that you aren't going to Paris to sit in your room anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: rms_traveler
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through Venere who seemed to have the best rate at around 115 Euro a night. The room was what we expected - small, but had everything we needed. A big bed, shower, heat, free internet in the lobby, etc. The metro stop is close by, but I think next time we will stay closer to more of the sights. The front desk people were very friendly and helpfull even on Christmas day. Breakfast was good - not extensive in the choices (croissants, baguettes, cereal, fruit, cheeses, etc) , but good. I would definately recommend this hotel and possibly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Miamilocal1
Reviews.Content: Very reasonably priced hotel centrally located in Paris. Service is very friendly and staff will go out of their way to help you. Clean rooms, comfortable beds and proximity to a nearby metro station (1.5 blocks) added to a good and recommended experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, helpful staff and we got a reallly large room...”
Reviews.Author: LenaW
Reviews.Content: We were two friends who stayed at the hotel 3 nights in October. I had booked a twin room for 140 Euro/night and in my reservation I told them that I had booked the hotel due to the good reviews on tripadvisor... We got room number 3, which was acutally 2 larger rooms (one twin and one double) and a very, very clean bathroom. The room overlooked a small, very Parishian court yard. The staff spoke very good English and assisted us in getting taxis and so forth. I would really, really recommend this hotel and I am very picky!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: BobH
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Castex Hotel for 5 nights in Oct 2006. I had read many favorable reviews including the 3 star recommendation from Rick Steves--the travel guru and decided to give it a whirl. I was not able to get a better price than 140 euros per night which is what they charge for a double room in high season. A complete buffet breakfast (everything except meats and eggs) is provided in a nice environment at 10 euros per breakfast--if you mention being referred to the hotel by Rick Steve's the breakfast is free during your stay (hehe..remember that name). The hotel is clean, has a nice sitting area in the lobby decorated in Louis IV furnishings and has a small elevator to service the 5 floors (30 rooms). If you want more space, pay for the double room even though it is still small by hotel standards. I stayed in Rm 504 which did not have a good view but the windows were large and can be opened for ventillation. the rooms are all air conditioned as well. My room had a comfortible bed, desk & chair, two closets to hang things as well as an average size bathroom with shower. However, the showers are hard to use--you have to remove the sprayer from its holder in order to use it properly and when trying to juggle soap too, that is a problem. I don't know why the hotel didn't spend a little more money for a proper shower head----the convenience would be much appreciated. The small tv in the room did not work. There are no carpets in the room, just a tile floor with a throw rug--probably a good idea for people with allergies. The hotel staff spoke relatively good english and was always helpful especially the owner's wife Veronique and one of the males, Octavia. They give good recommendations on tours, restaurants, transportation etc. The hotel is located on the outer boundaries of Le Marais on Rue Castex between Rue St. Antoine and Blvd Henri IV--4th Arrondissement (district) and close to the Bastille Arrondissement..both are very nice areas....young professionals living in these neighborhhods and it is less touristy than others. Public transportation is excellent...you can buy 1, 2, 3 or 5 day visitor cards good on Metro (subway, bus and suburban trains). The closest subway station to the hotel is the Bastille Station on Line 1& 5 which is 2 blocks from the hotel at the intersection where Rue St. Antoine and Blvd Henri IV come together--across from the statue commemorating the site of the original Bastille prison which no longer exists. there is no need to recommend restaurants here--there are so more bistros, cafes and restaurants than you can shake a stick at in Paris..just walk around and look at the menus and the decor and make up your mind..it is not rocket science..bon appetit! I higly recommed the 1.5 hour city bus tour of the highlights of Paris fo 17 euros--there are brochures in the hotel looby. The tour bus with headsets for each passenger givs the tour automatically in 8 or 9 longauages...pick up the tour outside the tour bus office on Rue des Pyramids and Rue Rivoli outside the Louvre. Also, please take a trip to the Chateau de Versailles 40 minute train trip from Paris which was the residence of royalty before their heads were lopped off...beatiful gardens and for 8 or 10 euros you can take a tour of the residence of the king and queen and see all of that opulence with a headset with english translations included. If you are in Paris on a Sunday, for some cheap Christmas gifts, take Metro Line 4 to the end of the norther terminal--Porte de Clignacourt--walk 2 or 3 blocks from the Metro Station to get to the large flea market---there are signs at the Metro Station on the street directing you to the flea market. This is my 2nd visit to Paris and it was a wonderful trip...I had much fun..enjoyed the people, food and sights. It is not a cheap city; bring plenty of cash...lol If you have further questions, contact me r.huffman@mindspring.com

Reviews.Title: “Connecting Rooms/Buffet Breakfast/RickSteve Discount”
Reviews.Author: rocknroll52
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Castex for 5 days in August 2006. We are a family of 4 including two teen girls. The availability of connecting rooms at this hotel is great for families with children. Here's the setup: two separate rooms, each with their own bathroom, connect via a small hallway off the elevator lobby with a door that can be locked from inside. So you can leave the bedrooms open to each other but have privacy from the rest of the hotel. We had rooms 203 and 204 which were both comfortable although the bed in room 204 sagged on one side. The buffet breakfast was excellent. It is nice when you have children to have the convenience of breakfast in your hotel. In addition to the usual bread, croissants and jam, breakfast at the Hotel Castex includes: fruit, yogurt, cheese, pate, fresh fruit, and cold cereals. And to drink: orange juice, hot chocolate, tea, hot milk, and hot coffee. The usual cost of breakfast is 10 euros which is a bargain by Paris standards. This hotel is in the Rick Steve Paris guidebook. By mentioning Rick Steve's book we were given breakfast free of charge, and the fifth night of our stay for free! This is a great value. A word about the Metro. The stairs to the Bastille stop (Yellow #1 Metro line) are close (about 2 blocks away) but to get to the actual Metro train is a much longer walk underground. Because of the walk to the Metro, parents with small children or the elderly might not find this location ideal. However, it is fine for older children and teens, and older family members who don't mind walking. Also, keep in mind that the Bastille stop is somewhat confusing with 6 exits ("sorties") and if you take the wrong one you will be quite far from the hotel. Look for the "Sortie" for Rue St. Antoine! Once on the Metro you can go directly to the Louvre, Champs Elysees, Rue de Rivoli, Tuileries and Arc de Triomphe. To get to the Eiffel Tower, go to Charles de Gaule Etoile, change to the #6 line and go to the Trocadero stop. There you will get a beautiful view of the Eiffel Tower as you approach. To visit Notre Dame you can either walk, or take the Metro to the Hotel de Ville stop. There are plenty of cafes in the neighborhood for casual dinners; we walked around at night and it was very safe. As we were there in August a number of shops and restaurants were closed; however, you have all the basics at your disposal within 2 blocks: newsstand, post office, ATM, grocery, pharmacy, patisserie, photo store. Also within walking distance are several nice attractions: the Picasso Musuem, Jewish History Musuem, Carnavalet Museum and Centre Georges Pompidou.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: twitchery
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Castex Hotel as part of our 3 week European vacation. It was our first time in Paris, so we took extra care in choosing exactly where we would stay. This hotel is located in the desirable 4e, right by the Bastille. After we were in Paris, we realized that the Metro will take you almost anywhere you need to go. We worried about not selecting a hotel right next to the major tourist sites in the 1e. We were so glad we didn't! Not only did we get a much better hotel rate, but we stayed among the Parisians! We stayed 3 nights and loved it. It was roughly 100 euros a night, which is a serious bargain in Paris, and we found that Venere.com had the best rates. We can't say enough about the staff. They were wonderful and extremely friendly. They all spoke English very well and were eager to help us with whatever we needed. The hotel is also air conditioned which is somewhat rare from what we learned there in Paris. We were there during the "heatwave" in late July, and it was our saving grace coming back to that chilly room each night. And the beds, so comfy you didn't want to get out of them in the morning! However, that delicious breakfast and excellent coffee were waiting for us downstairs, as well as Paris! The location couldn't be better; 2 blocks from the metro and around the corner from anything you could need- grocery, bakeries, cafes, clothing, laundromat, post office. The area was very "untouristy" and it felt like we were walking amongst the locals. We kept telling ourselves that we scored the whole time we were there. We'll definitely stay there again when we go back. It's a hidden little gem among a mass of choices.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel! Great price and location!”
Reviews.Author: globe.trotter.919
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a great part of the city right next to the Bastille. It is also a short walk to the trendy area around the Hotel de Ville. Convient, safe, great cafes around the place, relaxing and charming area. The front desk attendents were very nice, accomidating and helpful. They also spoke very good english. The housekeeping staff did a good job with the rooms, although they like to wake you up if you sleep in so they can get into your rooms to clean. Oh yes, and free wireless internet, which is great!! The room was clean, airy, a bit small though. It's not a Ritz-Carlton, but it is a great steal for the price, service, and location! Overall, a charming stay!

Reviews.Title: “So much better than expected!!”
Reviews.Author: la2019
Reviews.Content: We chose the Castex based entirely on reviews on this site. What a fantastic place! From the consistently helpful and friendly staff (offered us an umbrella when we were about to go out in the rain, and asked the cab driver how much the fair would be to the airport before they let him take our luggage) to the immaculately clean room, the place was just great. And the location couldn't really be better. When you go out the door, make a right, and your a few blocks from the Ile de St. Louis. Make a left, and your at the Bastille and the Marais. Good A/C too, although it was so mild out, that we slept with the window open instead. On a 3-week trip to Europe, we stayed at many nice hotels. This one was far and away the best of the trip! One other thing - yes, the room is small. But they've clearly put thought into maximizing the limited space. The result is a small room that feels much larger than it actually is. Bottom line; we go to Paris a lot, and this is the only hotel we're staying at from now on!

Reviews.Title: “Just a so-so hotel”
Reviews.Author: Doodlebug
Reviews.Content: I stayed in another hotel in Paris as well as the Castex and, sadly, the Castex was not nearly as nice as the other one, but cost more. The very small room wasn't too clean, but the bathroom was better. But I highly disliked the "telephone" showerhead that doesn't have anything to hook it on the wall - just handheld in the bathtub. Very unhandy. Had to keep laying it down on the bottom of the tub and picking it back up to use. Made showering a major ordeal. The breakfast was OK, but not worth E10. And the breakfast room was quite cramped. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. The Internet machine in the lobby was worthless (needed a special card to use). The closest Internet cafe was a 15 min. walk away and VERY expensive. The Marais is too busy for my taste. My room was very noisy (at the front of the hotel) and I was awakened several times at night and early morning by partying people, street cleaners, and trash trucks. I prefer a quieter neighborhood. The local Metro stop was just a few blocks away (Bastille), but nearly everywhere in Paris has a nearby metro stop.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great area”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Castex in February '05 with my boyfriend. Overall we really enjoyed the hotel, the location is great and the room while small, was pretty efficient. We had a room facing the street on the 3rd floor but we were isolated from any street noise. The hotel has an elevator which I'm told is huge for Paris standards. The bathroom is very small but it does well with the room it has. The fixtures and design all seemed very modern, the bathtub was comfortable, and the water pressure in the shower was unbelievable! The maids were very friendly, they are the ones serving the breakfast in the morning. It is normally 10 Euros but free for two people for your stay if you have Rick Steve's Paris book. I don't love the book but it was certainly worth it for the free breakfast. (The croissants were marvelous!!) The Castex is in a great area, near the Bastille which has 3 metro lines stopping there and it's near the heart of the Marais with great restaurants, shops and museums nearby. We didn't always love the staff at the desk, some of the people on the night shift seemed really junior. They were perplexed when we asked simple touristy questions (can you confirm our dinner reservation? where can we find internet access in the neighborhood? etc) but the woman at the desk each morning was helpful and overall we really enjoyed our stay. I almost forgot, the bed and pillows were very very comfortbale! Not like you usually find in hotels! There is also a promotion that gives you your 4th night free during certain months. That was the #1 reason we picked this place.
